listData.name: Standard Business Cheque Account - Interest Bearing Option
listData.description: Transaction accounts that pays interest above minimum balances.

features.additionalInfo: Access your own business funds to pay bills and suppliers online, over the phone or in person.
Rather than wait hours or days for payments from another bank to clear, receive money almost instantly, so you know exactly where your business stands financially.
See, track and easily pay your bills online in NetBank or on the go in the CommBank app.
Access a range of travel benefits through Travel Booking (provided by Hopper) for eligible customers.
Obtain Cheque Books.
Regardless of your business structure and needs, we have an online banking solution that will suit you.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Relationship managed clients only.

To be eligible you need to have a valid ABN, ACN, or an association created and operating in Australia. Further Eligibility depends on your specific organisation structure. Please see CommBank website below for more information.

fees.name: Coin handling fee
fees.additionalInfo: The coin handling is 1% of the total value of the coin component of all deposit and withdrawal transactions, where the total value of coins handled exceeds $1,000 per day. This fee is debited on the day the transactions are processed. This fee does not apply to deposits made via QuickCash envelopes.

fees.name: Dishonour fee
fees.additionalInfo: $5 per payment. Charged to the account, due to insufficient available funds, when we are unable to debit the account.

fees.name: Note handling fee
fees.additionalInfo: The note handling is 0.25% of the total value of the notes component of all deposit and withdrawal transactions, where the total value of notes handled exceeds $50,000 per day. This fee is debited on the day the transactions are processed. This fee does not apply to deposits made via QuickCash envelopes.

fees.name: Paper Statement Fee
fees.additionalInfo: A paper statement fee applies if you request a paper copy of an account statement at any time.

fees.name: Overdraw Fee
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged when you exceed the available funds in your account or any agreed overdraft limit on a given day. Additional interest may apply on overdrawn amounts.

fees.name: Monthly account fee
fees.additionalInfo: Calculated at the end of each month and charged to your account on the first day of the following month.

fees.name: Access fee - Overseas transactions
fees.additionalInfo: Any other cash withdrawal overseas: AUD $5 plus 3.5% of the transaction value.

fees.name: Access fee - Overseas transactions
fees.additionalInfo: Any other cash withdrawal overseas: AUD $5 plus 3.5% of the transaction value.

fees.name: Access fee - Overseas transactions
fees.additionalInfo: Maestro (EFTPOS) or Visa Debit Card or Debit MasterCard purchase in Australian dollars: 3.5% of the transaction value.

fees.name: Access fee - Overseas transactions
fees.additionalInfo: Maestro (EFTPOS) or Visa Debit Card or Debit MasterCard purchase in foreign currency: 3.5% of the transaction value.

fees.name: Withdrawals or transfers made via telephone banking using an operator
fees.additionalInfo: Withdrawals or transfers made via telephone banking using an operator.

fees.name: CommBank ATMs outside Australia
fees.additionalInfo: The fee is charged to the account at the time of the withdrawal. This fee may be charged for each withdrawal you make through ATMs and Maestro, Cirrus, MasterCard or Visa Plus networks outside Australia.

fees.name: Assisted transactions
fees.additionalInfo: Withdrawals made over the counter at a Commonwealth Bank branch, Australia Post office or private agency (including EFTPOB/Bank@Post).

fees.name: Cheques transactions
fees.additionalInfo: Cheques written by you and negotiated through the clearing system.

fees.name: Assisted transactions
fees.additionalInfo: Cheques drawn on your account and cashed over-the-counter at any Commonwealth Bank branch.

fees.name: Assisted deposits
fees.additionalInfo: Deposits made over the counter at a Commonwealth Bank branch, Australia Post office or private agency (including EFTPOB/Bank@Post).

fees.name: Cheque transactions
fees.additionalInfo: Cheques deposited to your account (including cheques deposited via Quick Deposits or QuickCash envelope banking).

fees.name: Electronic transactions
fees.additionalInfo: Commonwealth Bank ATM deposits or transfers in Australia; EFTPOS cash withdrawals or purchases in Australia; Direct Entry debits or credits or periodical payments; transfers via NetBank and telephone banking. Effective 1 August 2019, fees for Electronic transactions will not be charged. Please note Access, CommBiz and NetBank Service Fees may apply and are excluded from Electronic transaction fees.

lendingRates.additionalInfo: For each day your account remains overdrawn, Excess Debit Interest will be applied. This does not apply to accounts with an overdraft limit.
For each day your account remains overdrawn, Excess Debit Interest will be applied. This does not apply to accounts with an overdraft limit.

listData.name: NetBank Saver
listData.description: An online savings account with the flexibility to move money in and out of your linked CommBank transaction account using NetBank or the CommBank app.

features.additionalInfo: Wherever you are in the world, CommBank gives you the choice and control to securely manage all of your accounts on a range of devices, the way you want.
Pay and receive near real-time payments.
Whether you have a savings goal in mind or want to build a buffer for those 'just in case' moments, Goal Tracker in the CommBank app helps you set and reach your goals.
Unlimited CommBank electronic transactions.

eligibility.additionalInfo: For customers wanting to apply online, they will require an Australian residential address.

If you're already a CommBank customer, you'll need your NetBank Client Number. If you're not already a CommBank customer, you'll need an email address so we can create a NetBank Client Number for you.

You'll need to link an eligible CommBank transaction account to your NetBank Saver. Eligible accounts include a Smart Access, Complete Access, Everyday Offset, Pensioner Security or Streamline Basic account with CommBank in the same name as the NetBank Saver account. If you're new to CommBank or don't have an existing eligible transaction account to link to your NetBank Saver, then we'll automatically open a Smart Access account for you when you open a NetBank Saver. Fees may apply to these accounts.

fees.name: Paper Statement Fee
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged when you ask us to give you a paper copy of transaction listings, past statements or ordered statements.

fees.name: Paper Statement Fee
fees.additionalInfo: A fee charged for all issued paper statements on accounts designed exclusively for electronic use.

depositRates.additionalInfo: Fixed bonus margin for the first 5 months on your first NetBank Saver. The variable introductory interest rate will not apply to NetBank Saver accounts which are jointly owned where one of the account holders has previously held a NetBank Saver account.

detailData.name: NetBank Saver
detailData.description: An online savings account with the flexibility to move money in and out of your linked CommBank transaction account using NetBank or the CommBank app.

listData.name: Standard Term Deposit
listData.description: Feel confident knowing exactly how much your money will earn. Lock-in a competitive interest rate from as short as 1 month to as long as 5 years.

features.additionalInfo: Manage online and on the go: See, track and manage your Term Deposit alongside your other accounts in NetBank, CommBiz and the CommBank app. Know what you're earning: The fixed rate of return means you'll always know what your investment's worth and can plan how to use the interest earned.
Wherever you are in the world, CommBank gives you the choice and control to securely manage all of your accounts on a range of devices, the way you want.

Knowing when it matures. It's crucial to keep track of your Term Deposit so you have time to decide on a plan before it matures. We send you a letter roughly a week before your Term Deposit matures, letting you know your options. You can also opt-in for free account alerts (Choose between an email, SMS or NetBank notification) so we can remind you when your Term Deposit is due to mature.

features.additionalValue: Opt-in for free maturity alerts and e-notices
features.additionalInfo: Opt-in for free maturity alerts and e-notices. Opt in for alerts and we'll send you an email or SMS a week before your Term Deposit matures - so you never miss your maturity date. Opt in for e-notices and replace the clutter of paper notices. Look back at old notices in NetBank and we'll email you when a new one is available.
Set up an automated bank feed with your accounting software to get a secure, reliable connection directly into your accounting software. It just takes a couple of minutes in NetBank.

There are no set up or establishment fees. If you want to withdraw your Term Deposit before it matures you'll need to give us 31 days' notice. You may incur a prepayment interest adjustment and administration fee.

constraints.additionalInfo: The Term Deposit rates are available online and in branch for customers with a maximum limit of $1,999,999 per customer. For amounts greater than $1,999,999 or to open Business Term Deposits, please contact any CommBank branch or your relationship manager.
A minimum deposit of $5,000 (call or visit your nearest branch for investments $2,000,000 and over)
A minimum deposit of $5,000 (call or visit your nearest branch for investments $2,000,000 and over)

eligibility.additionalInfo: You can open a Term Deposit online under a personal or Self-Managed Super Fund (SMSF) name. To do so, you need to be 18 years or over.
Have an Australian residential address, or otherwise subject to exception.
Be individuals

eligibility.additionalValue: Be one of the following entity types, with at least one signatory aged 18 or older and a residential address in Australia:
eligibility.additionalInfo: A domestic business, e.g. a sole trader, partnership, company, trust, with an ABN or ACN.

eligibility.additionalValue: Be one of the following entity types, with at least one signatory aged 18 or older and a residential address in Australia:
eligibility.additionalInfo: A foreign company that carries on business in Australia, and is registered with ASIC; or owns property in Australia, but does not carry on a business in Australia.

eligibility.additionalValue: Be one of the following entity types, with at least one signatory aged 18 or older and a residential address in Australia:
eligibility.additionalInfo: A trust, superannuation fund, association, registered co-operative, body corporate or government body

fees.name: Prepayment administration fee and prepayment adjustment
fees.additionalInfo: You'll need to give us 31 days' notice to withdraw all or part of your funds if your Term Deposit hasn’t reached the end of the fixed term. A prepayment adjustment (variable amount) and $30 prepayment administration fee may apply if you withdraw your funds early. To see an example of how the Prepayment Interest Adjustment is calculated, please see our Terms & Conditions.

depositRates.additionalInfo: Holding facility rate. You can give us instructions at any time, once you decide what you want to do.

listData.name: Smart Access
listData.description: An everyday bank account, giving you access to unlimited electronic transactions and features to help your spending and bills stay on track. Plus if you meet certain criteria, we'll waive your $4 monthly account fee.

features.additionalInfo: Use instore, online and withdraw local currency at millions of locations, everywhere Mastercard is accepted. Choose a Debit Mastercard with your CommBank account and pay for things using your card, smartphone or wearable. You may receive access to other features and benefits associated with your Debit Mastercard subject to terms and conditions.
See, track and easily pay your bills online in NetBank or on the go in the CommBank app.
Use Cardless Cash in the CommBank app to get money out without having to use your card.
Securely lock your debit card in the CommBank app when you need to. And unlock it again when you don't.
CommBank Yello provides benefits for eligible CommBank customers, subject to terms and conditions.
Access a range of travel benefits through Travel Booking (provided by Hopper) for eligible customers.
Wherever you are in the world, CommBank gives you the choice and control to securely manage all of your accounts on a range of devices, the way you want.
Pay with your Apple(TM) device using Apple Pay.
Pay with your Android(TM) phone using the CommBank app.
Pay with your Fitbit(TM) smartwatch using Fitbit Pay.
Pay with your Garmin(TM) smartwatch using Garmin Pay.
Pay with your Android(TM) device using Google Pay.
Pay with your Samsung(TM) device using Samsung Pay.
Get faster payments between participating banks, anytime with a PayID.
Pay and receive near real-time payments.
We help you stay on track with your debit and credit card spending in the CommBank app.

Notifications are available in the CommBank app or via SMS to inform you if your account overdraws. This allows you to bring your account back into credit by midnight Sydney/Melbourne time to avoid fees and interest charges that may apply. You can choose to turn these notifications on or off any time in NetBank or the CommBank app.
Turn Transaction Notifications on in the CommBank app and we'll instantly alert you when you pay using your CommBank debit card, and when you receive money into your everyday account.
Manage payments from your bank account using PayTo.
Unlimited CommBank electronic transactions.

listData.name: Farm Management Deposit account (Fixed Term)
listData.description: A tax-effective investment that allows primary producers to set aside pre-tax income as a cash reserve for later years.

features.additionalInfo: Helps balance good and bad times, by allowing eligible customers to set aside their individual pre-tax income in good years as a cash reserve to withdraw from in less profitable years.

Funds held in a FMD account will be deducted from your assessable income in the year in which the deposit is made. Withdrawals are considered assessable income for that year's tax return. Keep in mind, deposits in the FMD account must be kept for at least 12 months to be eligible for tax benefits.
Flexibility to choose between a fixed term and at call investment option
View your Farm Management Deposit Account alongside your other accounts in NetBank and the CommBank app.
No account-keeping fees (standard government fees may apply).
Withdrawals and deposits are made by phoning your relationship manager, or visiting a branch of the Bank.
To withdraw part or all of your funds in advance of maturity ('prepayment'), you will need to give us 31 days' notice, and a prepayment adjustment and administration fee may apply.

constraints.additionalInfo: $1,000.00 in any individual FMD Account at any time.
Aggregate balance of all FMD Accounts must not exceed $800,000.00
Fixed Term FMD Account - $1,000.00

eligibility.additionalInfo: To be eligible for the scheme and to maintain FMD status, the account holder must be an individual primary producer (this can include the beneficiary of a trust, partner of a partnership, but not joint persons or companies) at the time when they open the account or make a deposit. Deposits must meet the criteria specified in the Income Tax Assessment Act 1997 and those outlined in the Terms and Conditions section of the Farm Management Deposit Accounts document. For further details on eligibility criteria refer to the Farm Management Deposits Law or visit the Department of Agriculture and Water Resources website at agriculture.gov.au. Account holders must also meet the FMD account eligibility criteria as set out by the ATO: https://www.ato.gov.au/business/primary-producers/in-detail/farm-management-deposits-scheme/

listData.name: BetterBusiness Loan
listData.description: A simple loan to help you manage or grow your business. It can be secured or unsecured with flexible repayment options. For Businesses that want to borrow from $10,000 for business purposes, want to make extra repayments and access them with redraw, want to pay interest only on the amount they owe and want flexibility in how they repay their loan.

features.additionalInfo: It's for business customers who want to borrow a set amount of money to pay back over a set loan term. Customers can choose to provide an asset, like a residential and/or commercial property, as security. Depending on whether a loan is secured or unsecured, total loan terms of up to 30 years are available subject to the Bank’s eligibility and suitability criteria. Speak to your Business Banker for more information.
It's suitable for various business costs and investment purposes
It's flexible to your needs. Choose a fixed or variable interest rate, your loan term, repayment frequency and type (interest only, principal and interest, or both), and loan security type
You can refinance existing business purpose debt
Digital access is available via Netbank, CommBank App and CommBiz
For secured loans you can nominate a guarantor during the origination process

If you're on a variable interest rate, you may be able to withdraw any additional repayments you make on your loan anytime. You can easily access your redraw online, through NetBank, the CommBank app or CommBiz.
Relationship management is available for eligible customers

features.additionalValue: What are the features of Agri Green Better Business Loan ?
features.additionalInfo: Discounted finance for eligible new environmental projects on your farm. Redraw is not available for Agri Green Loan. Other rates, fees,charges, lending criteria and T&C's apply.

features.additionalValue: What are the features of Business Green Better Business Loan ?

detailData.name: BetterBusiness Loan
detailData.description: A simple loan to help you manage or grow your business. It can be secured or unsecured with flexible repayment options. For Businesses that want to borrow from $10,000 for business purposes, want to make extra repayments and access them with redraw, want to pay interest only on the amount they owe and want flexibility in how they repay their loan.

listData.name: Society Cheque Account
listData.description: A transaction account for eligible not-for-profit and community organisations and associations, and organisations that operate for the benefit of the wider community. You can set one up in any of our branches.

features.additionalInfo: You can get one or multiple Business Visa debit card linked to your Society Cheque Account making it easier to track and record expenses.
Make reconciliation simpler by integrating your online accounting service with your Society Cheque Account in just one click.
Rather than wait hours or days for payments from another bank to clear, receive money almost instantly, so you know exactly where your business stands financially.
Access a range of travel benefits through Travel Booking (provided by Hopper) for eligible customers.
Bank online using NetBank or the CommBank mobile app, over the phone or in branch. We also have deposit ATMs for cash, cheques and coins.
There is no additional charge for Quick Deposit, Cheque and Assisted transactions for your Society Cheque Account.

features.additionalValue: Informal overdrawing requests (debit balances in your account without a formal Overdraft facility or automatic overdrawing limit)
features.additionalInfo: If you have a Business Transaction Account or a Society Cheque Account and you do not want us to honour payments which will cause that account to become informally overdrawn, you can request that we disable this overdraw feature on your account by using your account settings for the CommBank app or NetBank, by calling us on 13 2221 or by visiting your nearest branch.
No monthly account fee means one less expense and more money raised going towards those you are helping.
Pay and receive payments in realtime.
The standard statement cycle of Society Cheque Account is every four months.

CommBank over-the-counter and electronic transactions are free, so you can direct more funds to what matters most. Excludes non-Commonwealth Bank ATMs here and all ATMs overseas, EFTPOS transactions overseas, transfer group payments to third parties, international money transfers, CommBiz and NetBank service fees and separate services such as bank cheques, periodic payments and transfers/deposits to other banks. Wholesale relationship managed customers may be notified at any time that their account is subject to transaction fees on electronic transactions and Commonwealth ATM cash withdrawals.

eligibility.additionalInfo: A minor under the age of 16 years old cannot open or be a signatory to a non personal account. Check you're an eligible organisation or association. If you're not, see our other business accounts.

features.additionalInfo: Variable interest rates.
Manage online at any time. View, track and manage your account on CommBiz, Netbank and the CommBank App.
Choose from a range of notice periods. Our notice periods range from 2 to 370 days so you can tailor your returns based on your business needs.

constraints.additionalInfo: For 35 days' notice and above, there is a minimum initial deposit of $500,000.

eligibility.additionalInfo: For customers classified as Financial Institutions, notice periods of 35, 60 and 90 days are offered at the Bank's discretion. 2 & 7 day notices are not offered to Financial Institutions. listData.name: Business Investment Account
listData.description: Feel confident knowing exactly how much your money will earn. Lock-in a competitive interest rate with our range of fixed term deposits.

features.additionalInfo: View, track and manage your Business Investment Account alongside your other accounts in NetBank and the CommBank app.

With the Flexi Business Investment Account, you can access a set portion (as determined by the Bank) of the funds, if required, without being subject to prepayment interest adjustment and administration fees. If you need to withdraw beyond this portion on the Flexi Business Investment Account, or if you need to withdraw any money from the Business Investment Account during the fixed term, you will need to give us 31 days' notice, and a prepayment interest adjustment and administration fee may apply.
If you forget to let us know or haven't decided what to do with your funds at maturity, we'll keep them secure in a holding facility for up to six months.
For renewals, you can give alternative instructions within 7 calendar days, starting on the maturity date.

Prior to maturity, we will send you a Renewal notice. This notice will let you know what options are available and what you need to do. It will also tell you how we will treat your funds if you do not contact us before maturity.

constraints.additionalInfo: For Business Investment Account there is no maximum limit (subject to acceptance by the Bank). For Flexi Business Investment Account Balances over $20,000,000 accepted at the Bank's discretion.

fees.name: Prepayment administration fee and prepayment adjustment
fees.additionalInfo: If you need to withdraw money during the term, you may request withdrawal of all or part of your funds by giving the Bank 31 days' notice. A prepayment interest adjustment and administration fee may apply to withdrawals before maturity. If you have a Flexi Business Investment Account, you can access a set portion (as determined by the Bank) of the funds, if required, without being subject to prepayment interest adjustment and administration fees.  The prepayment interest adjustment and administration fee will apply for any withdrawals beyond this portion.

detailData.name: Business Investment Account
detailData.description: Feel confident knowing exactly how much your money will earn. Lock-in a competitive interest rate with our range of fixed term deposits.

listData.name: Business Transaction Account
listData.description: An everyday business bank account that you can open online, which provides unlimited electronic transactions and 5 assisted transactions on a monthly basis for customers on the $10 monthly account fee pricing option. Fees and charges will apply if you exceed this amount. Customers with the $0 monthly account fee pricing option will not have included assisted transactions - each assisted transaction will be chargeable. Please note Access, CommBiz and NetBank Service Fees may apply and are excluded from the unlimited electronic transactions.

features.additionalInfo: Access your own business funds to pay bills and suppliers online, over the phone or in person.
Rather than wait hours or days for payments from another bank to clear, receive money almost instantly, so you know exactly where your business stands financially.

Customers with the $10 Monthly Account Fee option will receive 5 Quick Deposit, Cheque and Assisted transactions each calendar month. The $0 Monthly Account Fee option does not include any assisted transactions - each assisted transaction will be chargeable. At the end of each month, the Bank will rank these transactions in the following order: 1. Quick Deposits - cash and cheque deposits 2. Cheque transactions 3. Assisted transactions.

listData.name: Statutory Trust Account
listData.description: The fast, easy and flexible way to meet your statutory obligations.

features.additionalInfo: Where allowed by law, you can access client funds through online banking, giving you the convenience of banking any time you choose. You can also access funds through your account chequebook, or through our extensive branch network, anywhere around Australia.

You'll have visibility of your statutory trust account 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, through our online banking services, NetBank or CommBiz. You can track transactions as they happen and view images of cheques deposited to your account. You'll also benefit from more detailed transaction data, making it easier to use and reconcile your account.
With NetBank or CommBiz, your accounts can be tracked and managed in one place - keeping your banking and administration fast and easy.

features.additionalValue: Fees and charges are made to the transaction account nominated by you.
features.additionalInfo: Fees and charges are not charged to the Statutory Trust Account but are charged to the transaction account nominated by you. If you have a Statutory Trust Account, you must maintain and nominate a valid transaction account from which any applicable fees and charges relating to the Statutory Trust Account may be debited.

features.additionalValue: Interest earned on Statutory Trust Accounts
features.additionalInfo: Any interest earned on Statutory Trust Accounts is paid to the relevant state or territory authority and interest rates may be zero.

Payments through the PEXA System from your eligible Statutory Trust Account or other eligible trust account can only be made if you are a subscriber to PEXA and have provided PEXA with the necessary authority. In addition to these terms and conditions, transactions carried out through the PEXA System are subject to PEXA's Financial Settlement Terms and Conditions. We are entitled to treat instructions received by PEXA which are authorised by your signatories' log in and password through the PEXA System as duly authorised by you.

Your clients can deposit directly to the trust account through our branches or by electronic transfer - using customised deposit slips and assigned agent numbers to simplify reconciliations and help you manage payments faster.

If you're required to hold client funds in trust, you need a compliant statutory trust account with easy access, full visibility and low administration costs. We'll set up your trust account in line with the requirements for your state, and pay interest directly to the relevant statutory body.

eligibility.additionalInfo: To be eligible you need to have a valid ABN, ACN, or an association created and operating in Australia. Further Eligibility depends on your specific organisation structure. Eligible customers typically include: Solicitors, Law Firms, Conveyancers, Conveyancing Solicitors, Real Estate Agents and Settlement Agents. To be eligible, these customers must give the following documents: Relevant industry license or practice certification and Written request to open a trust account, nominating a transaction account for the redirection of all fees and debit interest charges.

listData.name: Farm Management Deposit account (At Call)
listData.description: A tax-effective investment that allows primary producers to set aside pre-tax income as a cash reserve for later years.

features.additionalInfo: Helps balance good and bad times, by allowing eligible customers to set aside their individual pre-tax income in good years as a cash reserve to withdraw from in less profitable years.
Withdrawals and deposits are made by phoning your relationship manager, or visiting a branch of the Bank.
When you select an At Call Deposit you will receive a standard variable interest rate. Interest is calculated daily and paid quarterly on the full balance when $1,000 or more is held in the account.
View your Farm Management Deposit Account alongside your other accounts in NetBank and the CommBank app.
Flexibility to choose between a fixed term and at call investment option
No account-keeping fees (standard government fees may apply).

Funds held in a FMD account will be deducted from your assessable income in the year in which the deposit is made. Withdrawals are considered assessable income for that year's tax return. Keep in mind, deposits in the FMD account must be kept for at least 12 months to be eligible for tax benefits.

constraints.additionalInfo: Aggregate balance of all FMD Accounts must not exceed $800,000.00
$1,000.00 in any individual FMD Account at any time.
At Call FMD Account - $1,000.00

eligibility.additionalInfo: To be eligible for the scheme and to maintain FMD status, the account holder must be an individual primary producer (this can include the beneficiary of a trust, partner of a partnership, but not joint persons or companies) at the time when they open the account or make a deposit. Deposits must meet the criteria specified in the Income Tax Assessment Act 1997 and those outlined in the Terms and Conditions section of the Farm Management Deposit Accounts document. For further details on eligibility criteria refer to the Farm Management Deposits Law or visit the Department of Agriculture and Water Resources website at agriculture.gov.au. Account holders must also meet the FMD account eligibility criteria as set out by the ATO: https://www.ato.gov.au/business/primary-producers/in-detail/farm-management-deposits-scheme/

listData.name: Stream Working Capital
listData.description: Stream Working Capital is a digital working capital finance solution that gives businesses, that sell on credit terms, access to funds sized and secured by invoices.

features.additionalInfo: Access your own business funds to pay bills and suppliers online, over the phone or in person.
Rather than wait hours or days for payments from another bank to clear, receive money almost instantly, so you know exactly where your business stands financially.

Each assisted transaction will be chargeable. At the end of each month, the Bank will rank these transactions in the following order: 1. Quick Deposits - cash and cheque deposits 2. Cheque transactions 3. Assisted transactions.
Streamline your business banking and save time with automatic data feeds from your online banking to your accounting software.
See, track and easily pay your bills online in NetBank.
CommBank Yello for Business provides benefits for eligible CommBank customers, subject to terms and conditions.
Access a range of travel benefits through Travel Booking (provided by Hopper) for eligible customers.
You choose which invoices to use for finance, and when - the platform is available to use 24/7.
Stream is available on NetBank and Commbiz for your online banking needs.
A self-service platform that connects with Xero, MYOB, QuickBooks or other accounting software, providing an easily reconciled source of truth.
Funding is up to 80% of the value of outstanding invoices; the funding available will grow in line with your sales.
No monthly account keeping fees for the Stream Working Capital Transaction Account. Other fees will be detailed in your Letter of Offer and may include: a line fee and an establishment fee.
Pay and receive payments in realtime.
Stream Working Capital's dashboard shows real-time adjustments and balance reports to give you peace of mind about your cash flow position.

Unlimited CommBank ATM withdrawals in Australia. Each assisted transaction will be chargeable. Please note Access and NetBank Service Fees may apply and are excluded from the unlimited electronic transactions. Additional fees apply for: international transactions, travellers cheques, foreign currency and sending money overseas; special banking services, such as bank cheques and special clearance of cheques.

constraints.additionalInfo: $50,000 and above

eligibility.additionalInfo: Only business may apply for the account.
To use the platform, you'll need a Stream Working Capital Transaction Account to get your invoices paid into.
To be eligible you need to have a valid ABN.
Available to B2B customers issuing invoices to the value of AUD$15,000 per month or more.

fees.name: Coin handling fee
fees.additionalInfo: The coin handling is 1% of the total value of the coin component of all deposit and withdrawal transactions, where the total value of coins handled exceeds $1,000 per day. This fee is debited on the day the transactions are processed. This fee does not apply to deposits made via QuickCash envelopes.

fees.name: Dishonour Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $5 per payment. Charged to the account, due to insufficient available funds, when we are unable to debit the account.

fees.name: Note handling fee
fees.additionalInfo: The note handling is 0.25% of the total value of the notes component of all deposit and withdrawal transactions, where the total value of notes handled exceeds $50,000 per day. This fee is debited on the day the transactions are processed. This fee does not apply to deposits made via QuickCash envelopes.

features.additionalInfo: Avoid conversion fees when making and receiving payments in foreign currency without having to convert in and out of Australian dollars.

features.additionalValue: Manage the impact of short-term currency fluctuations
features.additionalInfo: Choose whether to convert funds into Australian dollars straight away, or hold at call in Australia and exchange at a later time.

No monthly account keeping fees. Fees may apply to linked accounts e.g. CommBank transaction or savings accounts.
Please check the Commbank website for current Credit Deposit Fee.

features.additionalInfo: And hold your money at call in Australia to use when you need it. For foreign currency cash withdrawals, please check at your local branch

eligibility.additionalInfo: Business Foreign Currency Accounts can only be opened for business purposes.

Domestic businesses (e.g. a sole trader, company, etc.), have an ABN or ACN where relevant.

listData.name: Everyday Offset
listData.description: Everyday Offset is a transaction account which is linked to an eligible home loan, and account holder(s) must also be account holders of the linked home loan. Interest is not charged on the part of the Home Loan balance equal to the Transaction account. Full terms and conditions for transaction and savings accounts are available at CommBank.com.au or from any branch of the Commonwealth Bank. Fees and charges apply.

features.additionalInfo: Use instore, online and withdraw local currency at millions of locations, everywhere Mastercard is accepted. Choose a Debit Mastercard with your CommBank account and pay for things using your card, smartphone or wearable. You may receive access to other features and benefits associated with your Debit Mastercard subject to terms and conditions.
CommBank Yello provides benefits for eligible CommBank customers, subject to terms and conditions.
Access a range of travel benefits through Travel Booking (provided by Hopper) for eligible customers.
Wherever you are in the world, CommBank gives you the choice and control to securely manage all of your accounts on a range of devices, the way you want.
Get faster payments between participating banks, anytime with a PayID.
Pay and receive near real-time payments.
There is no minimum balance needed for the offset to be applied to your home loan.

Maximise the benefits of offsetting by linking multiple Everyday Offsets to a Standard Variable Rate Home Loan or Investment Home Loan, provided they're in the name(s) of the loan borrowers. Each Everyday Offset can only be linked to one home loan at a time. Existing eligible CommBank accounts can be switched to an Everyday Offset.

An Everyday Offset can be linked to your Standard Variable Rate Home Loan or Investment Home Loan. Any money you put into your Everyday Offset reduces the balance on which we charge interest. However, you do not earn interest on the balance in your Everyday Offset, even if the balance exceeds the balance of the home loan.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Available to personal customers with a Standard Variable Rate Home Loan or Investment Home Loan.
Everyday Offset must be in the same name(s) as the borrowers on the home loan. You can open an Everyday Offset in your name or jointly with your Co-Borrower(s).

listData.name: Market Rate Loan
listData.description: A highly flexible loan with transparent pricing to support your business to grow, and repayment options to meet your cash flow cycle.

features.additionalInfo: It's for businesses that want to have the flexibility to have multiple loans within one facility that has an overall limit starting from $500,000.
It has a transparent interest rate linked to the Bank Bill Swap Bid rate (BBSY - published daily in the newspaper).
Choose a rollover period between 1 and 6 months. At the end of each rollover period, your interest rate will update based on the current BBSY.
Set different repayment schedules for each loan within the facility to suit your business cash flow.
Get expert advice from our Global Markets specialists to help you minimise your exposure to market interest rate fluctuations.
The Market Rate Loan facility supports up to 25 participating entities.
You can allow your entities to manage their individual cash flow requirements.
Structure your loan to flexibly manage your exposure to market rate changes.

For example, one of your loan accounts may have a 6 month reset period which lets you lock in a low interest rate, while another may have a 1 month reset period that lets you benefit from interest rates dropping again.
Choose to pay a fixed interest rate, by exploring a range of Interest Rate Risk Management (IRRM) options offered by our Global Markets team.
Our Global Markets specialists can give you expert advice.
Make interest only or principal plus interest repayments based on your business needs, and the type of investment you're making.
Loans can be fully secured, partially secured or unsecured.
Secure your loan with residential property, commercial property or other business assets.
View all your accounts in one place with CommBiz, keeping your banking and administration fast and straightforward.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Applications for finance are subject to the Bank's eligibility and suitability criteria and normal credit approval process.
Medium to large sized Australian businesses and not-for-profit organisations.
You must use the loan for business purposes only.
You must meet the Bank's lending policies and credit risk requirements.

Cover provided for the difference in price of a purchase if the same business item or personal good is advertised for a lower price in store within 21 days of purchase, within 25 kilometres of the store it was purchased. Provided the price difference is greater than $75, we will refund the price difference up to a maximum amount of $500 for any one item, set or pair items (including attached and unattached accessories). This is subject to conditions, exclusions, limits, sub-limits and terms. Refer to the Credit Card Insurances Product Disclosure Statement and Information Booklet for full details.

lendingRates.additionalInfo: From 10 December 2024, interest rates offered on approval vary from 10.99% p.a. to 15.99% p.a. The rate offered to you (your personalised interest rate) within this range depends on different factors, including your individual credit risk score. Once your credit contract is entered into, your personalised interest rate will be reviewed periodically and may change upon review. We may also vary the range of rates available for new Low Rate credit cards at any time. We ll notify you as outlined in the conditions of use if your personalised interest rate changes. All customers with an existing CommBank Low Rate credit card, and customers who switch from an existing CommBank credit card to a Low Rate credit card will be offered or will retain an interest rate of 13.99% p.a. This rate may be varied at any time during the term of the credit contract.

Refer to the Credit Card Insurances Product Disclosure Statement and Information Booklet for full details.

Cover provided for the difference in price of a purchase if the same business item or personal good is advertised for a lower price in store within 21 days of purchase, within 25 kilometres of the store it was purchased. Provided the price difference is greater than $75, we will refund the price difference up to a maximum amount of $500 for any one item, set or pair items (including attached and unattached accessories). This is subject to conditions, exclusions, limits, sub-limits and terms. Refer to the Credit Card Insurances Product Disclosure Statement and Information Booklet for full details.

Covers the repair or replacement cost of goods that are lost, stolen or damaged within 90 days of most purchases. Restrictions, exclusions, limits, sub-limits and excesses may apply.

Travel insurance included on your credit card provides cover for you, your spouse and your accompanied children for return trips from Australia, up to a set period. You will need spend at least $500 in a single transaction on your prepaid travel costs (e.g. the cost of your return overseas travel ticket, prepaid accommodation, cruise, travel or tour) by charging the cost for that trip on your eligible card account before leaving Australia and activate to receive any cover, including Overseas Medical cover. You will also qualify if the $500 worth of prepaid travel costs is redeemed using CommBank Awards points. You will need to provide a copy of the letter/statement/email confirming the redemption. Conditions, restrictions, exclusions, limits, sub-limits and excesses apply. CBA and its related bodies corporate do not issue or guarantee this insurance. It does not represent a deposit with or liability of either CBA or any of its related bodies corporate. We do not provide any advice on this insurance based on any consideration of your objectives, financial situation or needs. You can earn up to 3 Awards points or 1.2 Qantas Points for eligible purchases you make on the Ultimate Awards card. You get 3 Awards points or 1.2 Qantas Points for every $1 spent on international transactions. International transactions include any purchase you make overseas or when shopping online from Australia if the merchant or entity who processes the payment is based overseas. You get 2 Awards points or 0.8 Qantas Points for every $1 spent at major Australian supermarkets, department stores, petrol stations, dining and utilities. Earning these points depends on how the merchant categorises their business and provide us this information (directly or through their financial institution). You're unable to get these points if you use an intermediary platform such as PayPal for these transactions. You get 1 Awards point or 0.4 Qantas Points for every $1 spent on all other purchases. Once you have spent $10,000 in any given statement period, you will earn 0.5 Awards points or 0.2 Qantas Points for every dollar you spend on any other purchases within that period.

Earn up to 100,000 CommBank Awards points or up to 70,000 Qantas Points. Earn 25,000 CommBank Awards points or 17,500 Qantas Points each month when you spend $3,000 or more per month for the first 4 months on a new Ultimate Awards credit card. Ongoing eligibility, exclusions and offer Ts&Cs apply.

Get faster approval when upgrading or replacing financed assets if you have 12 months of good repayment history. Our simple Replacement Pathway is available for businesses who are upgrading or replacing business cars or equipment currently under finance. Approvals are conditional and subject to the replacement asset being suitable to the Bank. Acceptable evidence of good payment history is required. The asset being purchased must not be older than the asset being replaced. The finance agreement on the asset being replaced must be repaid and the new repayment must not increase by more than 25 per cent. Additional information may be requested depending on your application details, the asset being financed and individual circumstances.

listData.name: Virtual Cards
listData.description: Virtual Cards are a streamlined travel and procurement management solution, which provides large businesses the ability to take advantage of extended payment terms, transaction level payment security, and transaction level data through the deployment of single-use virtual cards.

features.additionalInfo: Card numbers are generated dynamically for each payment that is made, with an unlimited number able to be created. No physical card is issued on this account.
The full balance will be automatically swept from the nominated bank account on the settlement date.
Complimentary transit accident insurance up to $250,000 for cardholders.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Each application for credit is assessed on the ability of the business to service debt (limit) based on the financials supplied in the application. Suitability of the product is assessed through a workshop process between the client and the bank.

fees.name: International Transaction Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Applies anytime cash advances, purchases or permitted transactions are converted by Mastercard from foreign currencies to Australian dollar equivalents. For cash advances, the relevant cash advance charge will also apply. Also applies to purchases while the accountholder is overseas, or while they are in Australia (for example online) where the merchant, or the financial institution or entity processing the transaction, is located overseas. Please note additional fees may be charged by the overseas merchant.

fees.name: Cash equivalent items or cash substitutes cash advance charge
fees.additionalInfo: While no physical card is available to withdraw cash, the bank charges interest (17.99%) for customers using their Virtual Cards for a cash equivalent item or cash substitutes. Cash equivalent items or cash substitutes include the purchase of travellers cheques and foreign currency, e.g. Travelex, as well as online gambling, e.g. Sportsbet, Pokerstars, Online Lottery and TAB.

fees.name: Annual Fee per card
fees.additionalInfo: The disclosed annual fee amount per card is the fixed fee we have agreed with you. The fee for each card will be charged to each card on the facility anniversary date. Where a card is established between anniversary dates, a prorated fee is applied for that year.

features.additionalInfo: A wide range of shares and managed funds in the Approved Securities List, allowing investors to borrow money to accelerate their wealth creation and diversify their investment portfolio, using existing investments or cash as security.

Flexible interest rate and repayment options, with no minimum balance requirements

listData.name: CommBank AdvancePay
listData.description: CommBank AdvancePay gives you access to money you expect to be paid, before your next pay day. It's a short term facility applied to your personal everyday account as a temporary limit.

features.additionalValue: Access money at a time that suits you
features.additionalInfo: Get access to a minimum amount of $300 before your next pay day. There's no need to contact or involve your employer.

If eligible, you can apply through NetBank or the CommBank app in just a few minutes. If your application is approved, your limit should be available instantly (usually within seconds but may take up to 1 business day).
You'll be charged a fee depending on the amount you ask for. There are no extra charges if you pay back on time.

features.additionalValue: Access available via Netbank and CommBank App

eligibility.additionalInfo: You must have your income paid into a CommBank Smart Access or Complete Access account (not a joint account).
You must be registered for NetBank.
You must have earned enough income at the time of applying to meet our $300 minimum limit.
Your next pay date must be 2 days or more away.
You must have accessed CommBank AdvancePay less than 8 times in the last 12 months if you're paid weekly or fortnightly or 4 times if you're paid monthly
For personal use only.
Applications for Personal Overdrafts are subject to the Bank's normal credit approval.

fees.name: Upfront fee
fees.additionalInfo: Variable Upfront Fee. There is a single, upfront fee of $5 for every $500 (or part of) you ask for. This fee is charged when your CommBank AdvancePay limit is applied to your account, regardless of whether the temporary limit is accessed or not. Your final limit will be made up of the amount approved and the fee.

lendingRates.additionalInfo: If your CommBank AdvancePay limit is not fully repaid once your chosen pay date arrives, your account will be considered overdrawn and you’ll be charged the debit excess interest rate.

Pay weekly, fortnightly or monthly via direct debit. If you pay by any other means, your repayments will be monthly.
Wherever you are in the world, CommBank gives you the choice and control to securely manage all of your accounts on a range of devices, the way you want.

features.additionalValue: Additional repayments and Early Repayment Adjustment
features.additionalInfo: You can make additional repayments, subject to an early repayment adjustment. Additional repayments made on a Fixed Rate Loan are not available to be redrawn. We may charge an early repayment adjustment if loan is fully repaid with 12 or more months remaining on loan term, and we reasonably estimate we will incur a loss or administrative cost.
Interest is fixed so you know what your repayments will be for the life of the loan
You can typically borrow at a lower rate than an unsecured loan by using the car that you're buying as security for a secured personal loan

eligibility.additionalInfo: Individuals must have the legal capacity to enter into the loan contract. Not available for non-personal borrowers.

eligibility.additionalValue: Must live in Australia and be either: an Australian citizen, an Australian permanent resident (permanent visa sub class holder), a New Zealand citizen, or eligible non-resident visa holder.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Meet CBA's credit assessment criteria which includes demonstrating the capacity to make the required repayments on the credit facility without substantial hardship.
The maximum number of borrowers eligible to apply per application is one.

eligibility.additionalValue: Purpose of the loan - Buying a car
eligibility.additionalInfo: A Secured Personal Loan can be used for buying a new or used car up to seven years old that doesn't have any finance owing on it. The amount can be for the full or partial purchase price depending on whether you've paid a deposit. You're unable to borrow for additional loan purposes (e.g. a car for $20,000 and furniture for $5,000 is not accepted) when buying a car.
The vehicle being used as security must not have any finance owing on it
Individuals must have comprehensive insurance on the vehicle they are using as security

fees.name: Establishment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Upfront cost payable when accepting a loan.

fees.name: Loan service fee
fees.additionalInfo: Monthly charge to cover costs of keeping account active.

fees.name: Late payment fee
fees.additionalInfo: May be payable on the fifth business day after the repayment due date if at the end of the previous business day your loan is in arrears

fees.name: Early repayment adjustment
fees.additionalValue: We may charge an early repayment adjustment if loan is fully repaid with 12 or more months remaining on loan term, and we reasonably estimate we will incur a loss or administrative cost.
fees.additionalInfo: An early repayment adjustment may be made to cover reasonable administrative costs and estimated losses incurred by CBA as a result of you closing your fixed term loan early. This fee will not exceed the reasonable administrative costs and estimated losses arising from the early full repayment of your personal loan.

features.additionalValue: Additional repayments and Early Repayment Adjustment
features.additionalInfo: You can make additional repayments, subject to an early repayment adjustment. Additional repayments made on a Fixed Rate Loan are not available to be redrawn. We may charge an early repayment adjustment if loan is fully repaid with 12 or more months remaining on loan term, and we reasonably estimate we will incur a loss or administrative cost.
Interest is fixed so you know what your repayments will be for the life of the loan.

You may be eligible for same day funding if you're approved, accept your contract and complete verification by 4pm Monday to Friday (Sydney/Melbourne time). Subject to credit checks and assessment of your financial situation. Unavailable for secured loans, if an application is incomplete or needs to be referred for a more detailed review by a lending specialist, if required documentation isn't provided and subject to system availability.
Security is not required for this loan type.

The maximum number of borrowers eligible to apply per application is one.

detailData.name: Fixed Rate Personal Loan
detailData.description: Stay in control with a fixed interest rate and fixed repayments for the life of the loan.

listData.name: Extra Home Loan (Investment)
listData.description: A home loan with a variable interest rate and low fees.

features.additionalInfo: Your home loan comes with a fee-free redraw facility. You can make unlimited additional repayments at any time with no fees or penalties. You can access any additional money you pay, over and above your minimum required repayment.
You can apply to top up your home loan by an additional $10,000 or more - subject to equity in your property and our approval.

Switching is a change to one or more aspects of your loan's terms and conditions, for example switching from a variable rate to a fixed rate or switching from Interest Only payments to Principal and Interest repayments. Switching to an Extra Home Loan from another CBA Home/Investment Home Loan product is subject to approval.

Ability to split your loan balance into multiple loan accounts to take advantage of both fixed and variable rate home loans. This gives you the flexibility to structure your home loan to suit your individual needs by choosing the loan amount, loan type, loan term and repayment structure for each loan.
Additional repayments can be made at any time. No fees apply.
Wherever you are in the world, CommBank gives you the choice and control to securely manage all of your accounts on a range of devices, the way you want.

A guarantor is someone who agrees to be responsible for repaying a debt owed to us under a loan provided to another individual if the borrower (or borrowers) cannot make their repayments. A guarantor supports the loan by providing us with an additional security such as their home. By providing a guarantee, we may lend to the borrower in situations where they may not have been able to secure the full amount of the loan they require.

This loan can be used for the purposes of investment property purchases, refinancing your existing home loan, purchasing of vacant land (non-commercial), personal needs (e.g. home renovations, consolidation of personal debt and personal investments), off the plan purchases and building/construction purposes.
This loan cannot be used for bridging loans and business purposes.
1-30 years

constraints.additionalInfo: For an Extra Home Loan with a life of Loan discount, there is a minimum loan amount of $10,000 for new loans.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Not available for non-personal borrowers.
Individuals (natural persons) must have the legal capacity to enter into the loan contract, provide acceptable identification documentation and be 18 years or older.
Applications for home loans are subject to the Bank's normal credit approval.

Individuals must either be living in Australia as an Australian citizen, New Zealand citizen, Australian permanent resident or specified temporary Australian resident; or be an overseas citizen co-borrowing with an Australian citizen or Australian permanent resident or be living overseas as an Australian citizen or Australian permanent resident.

fees.name: Settlement Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $150 if the disclosure date in the contract is before 03/02/12. Payable regardless whether we attend settlement or not, when the Bank or our representative, arranges the funding of the loan.

fees.name: Settlement Cheque Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you require additional cheques (more than two) to fund / settle the loan. Fee applied per cheque.

fees.name: Late Payment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: For home loans - If your account falls into arrears, you will be charged a late payment fee. This fee is payable on the fifth business day after the monthly repayment due date. We will continue to charge the fee monthly until you repay all arrears or you enter into an arrangement with us for the full repayment of those arrears (even if you repay your loan weekly or fortnightly). If you break that arrangement the fee will continue to apply.

fees.name: Settlement Fee (Discharge)
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you discharge the loan, i.e. either sell part or all of the Security Property or refinance your Loan with another credit provider.

fees.name: Additional Security Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if we required you to provide more than one security and one of these securities is new

fees.name: Periodical Payments or Transfers
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you arrange a periodical payment or ask us to transfer funds.

fees.name: Progressive Drawing Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when the Bank makes a number of progressive payments to fund your loan amount. Payable at your final drawing. Fee is applied per drawing.

fees.name: Security Guarantee Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if a guarantor is listed on the loan schedule. Fee is applied per borrower.

fees.name: Security Substitution Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you ask us to substitute one of your securities with another.

fees.name: Stop Payment Notice Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you ask us to stop payment on a cheque you have written. Fee is applied per request.

fees.name: Voucher Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $4 per voucher (minimum charge $12) or $60 per hour spent to retrieve voucher(s). Payable if you ask us to retrieve a voucher (i.e. deposit, credit or debit slips) that records a transaction on the Loan Account.

fees.name: Lenders' Mortgage Insurance/Low Deposit Premium
fees.additionalInfo: Lenders' Mortgage Insurance (LMI) or Low Deposit Premium (LDP) may apply where there is an increased risk associated with a home loan. The circumstances of your loan determine whether a loan will incur LMI or LDP. They are a one-off cost added to the total loan amount. The LMI premium is passed on to you and is not an establishment fee. The LDP is a bank fee and not an establishment fee.

fees.name: Annual Service Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if your home loan is with the former State Bank of Victoria and the terms and conditions state the fee is required.

detailData.name: Extra Home Loan (Investment)
detailData.description: A home loan with a variable interest rate and low fees.

listData.name: 2 year Fixed Rate Home Loan (Investment)
listData.description: An investment home loan where the interest rate is fixed for 2 years.

features.additionalInfo: Fixed Rates are subject to change up until funding. 'Rate Lock' is an optional feature that allows you to lock in your reference interest rates on new Fixed Rate Home Loan and Fixed Rate Investment Home Loan applications for 90 days for a non-refundable fee, charged per fixed rate loan account. This excludes Home Seeker applications, CommBank Green Loan applications, switching, splitting, top-ups, loan purpose transfers or repayment changes. Rate Lock can be requested any time before loan documents are issued and the reference interest rates applicable to your Rate Lock will be on the date we receive the completed Rate Lock consent from all applicants. The Rate Lock fee will be debited from your Related Account when the Rate Lock request is processed. If there are insufficient funds in that account, or the account is no longer open, then the Rate Lock fee will be charged to your home loan and your home loan will go into arrears (and fees may be charged). The 90 days commences when the Rate Lock request is processed. You can ask us to break the Rate Lock before funding (for example, if rates go down) and revert to the reference interest rates available on the funding date.

You can make additional repayments of up to $10,000 for each year of your fixed rate loan, without incurring additional charges. Excluding Interest in advance periods. Administrative Fee and an Early Repayment Adjustment (ERA) may apply. See the 'Additional repayments' section in the Fixed Rate Home Loan fact sheet for more details.

Redraw is not available during a fixed rate period. However, if you do make additional repayments during a fixed rate period, or had available redraw when you entered your fixed rate period, the redraw feature will become available at the expiry of the fixed rate. The amount available is adjusted so that at the end of your agreed loan term, both your loan balance and the available redraw will be zero.

Through a top up you can borrow an additional $10,000 or more - subject to equity held in your property and our approval. However it's important to know that a top up would break your fixed rate contract and Administrative Fee and an Early Repayment Adjustment (ERA) may apply. Please contact us to discuss this. They are not permitted during the Interest in Advance period.

Switching is a change to one or more aspects of your loan's terms and conditions, for example switching from a variable rate to a fixed rate or switching from Interest Only payments to Principal and Interest repayments. You may be charged an Administrative Fee and Early Repayment Adjustment (ERA) if you switch out of your fixed rate loan.

Splitting is when you divide one loan into two or more loan accounts, generally with different loan types, repayment types or interest rates. You may be charged an Administrative Fee and Early Repayment Adjustment (ERA) if you split your fixed rate loan.

Enjoy interest rate discounts, no establishment fees and no monthly loan service fees for eligible home loans, and a fee waiver on one eligible credit card. To receive these benefits you must qualify for the home loan Package and have an initial Package lending balance of at least $150,000 at the time of your application.
Wherever you are in the world, CommBank gives you the choice and control to securely manage all of your accounts on a range of devices, the way you want.

A guarantor is someone who agrees to be responsible for repaying a debt owed to us under a loan provided to another individual or business  if the borrower (or borrowers) cannot make their repayments. A guarantor supports the loan by providing us with an additional security such as their home. By providing a guarantee, we may lend to the borrower in situations where they may not have been able to secure the full amount of the loan they require.

This loan can be used for the purposes of investment property purchases, refinancing your existing home loan, purchasing of vacant land (non-commercial) and personal needs (e.g.home renovations, consolidation of personal debt and personal investments).
This loan cannot be used for business purposes, bridging loans, off the plan purchases and building/construction purposes

If you have a Fixed Rate Investment Home Loan with Interest Only payments, you can pay Interest 12 months in advance and there is only one interest rate option, being Interest Only rate less a 0.20% p.a. discount.
At Maturity of the fixed term, the Fixed Rate Home loan will switch to SVR Investment Home loan and the interest rate will revert to the SVR Rate applicable to your loan and repayment type.
1-30 years

constraints.additionalInfo: For a Fixed Rate Loan, there is a minimum loan amount of $10,000 for new loans.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Not available for non-personal borrowers.
Non-trading Companies and/or Family/Unit/Hybrid Trusts.

Individuals (natural persons, including as Trustee of a Family Trust) must have the legal capacity to enter into the loan contract, provide acceptable identification documentation and be 18 years or older.
Applications for home loans are subject to the Bank's normal credit approval.

Individuals must either be living in Australia as an Australian citizen, New Zealand citizen, Australian permanent resident or specified temporary Australian resident; or be an overseas citizen co-borrowing with an Australian citizen or Australian permanent resident or be living overseas as an Australian citizen or Australian permanent resident.

fees.name: Establishment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $800 establishment fee charged on off the plan purchase for new and existing home loan. $600 for each of the 1st two loans plus $300 for each additional loan charged on split loans with variable and fixed rate options. $300 establishment fee charged if you increase an existing home loan. Establishment fee is payable to cover the costs the Bank incurs in establishing your loan and unless it is waived by us, is payable at the date of settlement or funding. It does not include other fees and charges also payable at the time of entering into the loan such as those associated with the settlement of the loan or the particular circumstances of the loan.

discounts.description: Discount applies based on customer eligibility.
discounts.additionalValue: Discount applicable for customers with a home loan Package. Upfront establishment and Top Up fee waived.
discounts.additionalInfo: Not payable if you take up a home loan Package with your eligible home loan.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Must currently have or be applying for a home loan with an initial 'package lending balance' of at least $150,000 when you apply for your Home Loan Package. A Home Loan Package can be established in single or joint names or in the name of one corporate entity. It cannot be established in the name of a business or family investment trust. Trust loans can be linked to the trustee Package (personal or company) where the trustee is an applicant i.e. the borrower on the home loan.

fees.name: Loan Service Fee
fees.additionalInfo: For Investment home loans, unless it is waived by us, the fee is charged monthly to each Loan Account on the repayment due date. For Interest in Advance Investment Home Loans, unless it is waived by us,the fee is charged to the Related Account monthly on the first business day of each month.

discounts.description: Discount applies based on customer eligibility.
discounts.additionalValue: Discount applicable for customers with a home loan Package. The Loan Service Fee is waived every month while your eligible home loan participates in a home loan Package.
discounts.additionalInfo: Not payable if you take up a home loan Package with your eligible home loan.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Must currently have or be applying for a home loan with an initial 'package lending balance' of at least $150,000 when you apply for your Home Loan Package. A Home Loan Package can be established in single or joint names or in the name of one corporate entity. It cannot be established in the name of a business or family investment trust. Trust loans can be linked to the trustee Package (personal or company) where the trustee is an applicant i.e. the borrower on the home loan.

fees.name: Rate Lock Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $750 per Rate Lock. Payable if you elect to lock in your interest rates and is charged when we set up your home loan or when your rate lock request is processed (if requested later). This non-refundable fee applies to 1-5 Year Fixed Rate home loans only. We will lock in the interest rates from when we receive your completed rate lock form and will end 90 days after we process your rate lock request. Fee applies per rate lock.

fees.name: Settlement Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $150 if the disclosure date in the contract is before 03/02/12. Payable regardless of whether we attend settlement or not, when the Bank or our representatives, arranges the funding of the loan.

fees.name: Settlement Cheque Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you require additional cheques (more than two) to fund / settle the loan. Fee applied per cheque.

fees.name: Late Payment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: For home loans - If your account falls into arrears, you will be charged a late payment fee. This fee is payable on the fifth business day after the monthly repayment due date. We will continue to charge the fee monthly until you repay all arrears or you enter into an arrangement with us for the full repayment of those arrears (even if you repay your loan weekly or fortnightly). If you break that arrangement the fee will continue to apply.

fees.name: Settlement Fee (Discharge)
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you discharge the loan, i.e. either sell part or all of the Security Property or refinance your Loan with another credit provider.

fees.name: Administrative Fee
fees.additionalInfo: An Administrative fee is payable if you repay your home loan in full before the fixed interest rate period expires; or make partial prepayments which exceed $10,000 in any year of your fixed rate loan.

fees.name: Early Repayment Adjustment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: An Early Repayment Adjustment is payable if you make partial prepayments on a fixed rate loan which exceed $10,000 in any year of your fixed rate loan (including paying the loan off in full); or make full prepayment during a capped or one-year guaranteed rate period of a home loan; or switch your Fixed Rate loan before the selected fixed or guaranteed rate period expires; or Top up the amount of credit of a home loan during a fixed or guaranteed rate period.

fees.name: Additional Security Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if we require you to provide more than one security (i.e. the security used to support the repayment of the loan), and one or more of these securities is 'new' i.e. does not already secure another loan. Fee is applied  per 'new' security.

fees.name: Periodical Payments or Transfers
fees.additionalInfo: $1.80 plus transfer fee, bank cheque fee and postage as applicable. Payable if you arrange a periodical payment or ask us to transfer funds.

fees.name: Progressive Drawing Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when the Bank makes a number of progressive payments to fund your loan amount. Payable at your final drawing. Fee is applied per drawing.

fees.name: Security Guarantee Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if a guarantor is listed on the loan schedule. Fee is applied per borrower.

fees.name: Security Substitution Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you ask us to substitute one of your securities with another.

fees.name: Stop Payment Notice Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you ask us to stop payment on a cheque you have written. Fee is applied per request.

fees.name: Voucher Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $4 per voucher (minimum charge $12) or $60 per hour spent to retrieve voucher(s). Payable if you ask us to retrieve a voucher (i.e. deposit, credit or debit slips) that records a transaction on the Loan Account.

fees.name: Trust Investigation Fee
fees.additionalInfo: To be advised when we calculate the fee. Payable if we incur investigation cost for loans involving a Trust. This fee applies even if we don't give you a loan. (Refer to UTC Clause 2.1)

fees.name: Home Loan Package Fee
fees.additionalInfo: The fee is charged annually to your nominated account when you add a Wealth Package (non-broker customers only) or Mortgage Advantage (broker customers only) to your eligible home loan to access special discounts. To be eligible for a Package you must have an initial 'Package lending balance' (total of all eligible home loans and the credit limit of Viridian Line of Credit) of at least $150,000 at the time of applying.

fees.name: Lenders' Mortgage Insurance/Low Deposit Premium
fees.additionalInfo: Lenders' Mortgage Insurance (LMI) or Low Deposit Premium (LDP) may apply where there is an increased risk associated with a home loan. The circumstances of your loan determine whether a loan will incur LMI or LDP. They are a one-off cost added to the total loan amount. The LMI premium is passed on to you and is not an establishment fee. The LDP is a bank fee and not an establishment fee.

fees.name: Annual Service Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if your home loan is with the former State Bank of Victoria and the terms and conditions state the fee is required.
