Individuals must either be living in Australia as an Australian citizen, New Zealand citizen, Australian permanent resident or specified temporary Australian resident; or be an overseas citizen co-borrowing with an Australian citizen or Australian permanent resident or be living overseas as an Australian citizen or Australian permanent resident.

fees.name: Establishment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $800 establishment fee charged on off the plan purchase for new and existing home loan. $600 for each of the 1st two loans plus $300 for each additional loan charged on split loans with variable and fixed rate options. $300 establishment fee charged if you increase an existing home loan. Establishment fee is payable to cover the costs the Bank incurs in establishing your loan and unless it is waived by us, is payable at the date of settlement or funding. It does not include other fees and charges also payable at the time of entering into the loan such as those associated with the settlement of the loan or the particular circumstances of the loan.

discounts.description: Discount applies based on customer eligibility.
discounts.additionalValue: Discount applicable for customers with a home loan Package. Upfront establishment and Top Up fee waived.
discounts.additionalInfo: Not payable if you take up a home loan Package with your eligible home loan.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Must currently have or be applying for a home loan with an initial 'package lending balance' of at least $150,000 when you apply for your Home Loan Package. A Home Loan Package can be established in single or joint names or in the name of one corporate entity. It cannot be established in the name of a business or family investment trust. Trust loans can be linked to the trustee Package (personal or company) where the trustee is an applicant i.e. the borrower on the home loan.

fees.name: Loan Service Fee
fees.additionalInfo: For investment home loans, unless it is waived by us, the fee is charged monthly to each Loan Account on the repayment due date. For Interest in Advance Investment Home Loans, unless it is waived by us, the fee is charged to the Related Account monthly on the first business day of each month.

discounts.description: Discount applies based on customer eligibility.
discounts.additionalValue: Discount applicable for customers with a home loan Package. The Loan Service Fee is waived every month while your eligible home loan participates in a home loan Package.
discounts.additionalInfo: Not payable if you take up a home loan Package with your eligible home loan.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Must currently have or be applying for a home loan with an initial 'package lending balance' of at least $150,000 when you apply for your Home Loan Package. A Home Loan Package can be established in single or joint names or in the name of one corporate entity. It cannot be established in the name of a business or family investment trust. Trust loans can be linked to the trustee Package (personal or company) where the trustee is an applicant i.e. the borrower on the home loan.

fees.name: Rate Lock Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $750 per Rate Lock. Payable if you elect to lock in your interest rates and is charged when we set up your home loan or when your rate lock request is processed (if requested later). This non-refundable fee applies to 1-5 Year Fixed Rate home loans only. We will lock in the interest rates from when we receive your completed rate lock form and will end 90 days after we process your rate lock request. Fee applies per rate lock.

fees.name: Settlement Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $150 if the disclosure date in the contract is before 03/02/12. Payable regardless of whether we attend settlement or not, when the Bank or our representatives, arranges the funding of the loan.

fees.name: Settlement Cheque Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you require additional cheques (more than two) to fund / settle the loan. Fee applied per cheque.

fees.name: Late Payment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: For home loans - If your account falls into arrears, you will be charged a late payment fee. This fee is payable on the fifth business day after the monthly repayment due date. We will continue to charge the fee monthly until you repay all arrears or you enter into an arrangement with us for the full repayment of those arrears (even if you repay your loan weekly or fortnightly). If you break that arrangement the fee will continue to apply.

fees.name: Settlement Fee (Discharge)
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you discharge the loan, i.e. either sell part or all of the Security Property or refinance your Loan with another credit provider.

fees.name: Administrative Fee
fees.additionalInfo: An Administrative fee is payable if you repay your home loan in full before the fixed interest rate period expires; or make partial prepayments which exceed $10,000 in any year of your fixed rate loan.

fees.name: Early Repayment Adjustment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: An Early Repayment Adjustment is payable if you make partial prepayments on a fixed rate loan which exceed $10,000 in any year of your fixed rate loan (including paying the loan off in full); or make full prepayment during a capped or one-year guaranteed rate period of a home loan; or switch your Fixed Rate loan before the selected fixed or guaranteed rate period expires; or Top up the amount of credit of a home loan during a fixed or guaranteed rate period.

fees.name: Additional Security Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if we require you to provide more than one security (i.e. the security used to support the repayment of the loan), and one or more of these securities is 'new' i.e. does not already secure another loan. Fee is applied  per 'new' security.

fees.name: Periodical Payments or Transfers
fees.additionalInfo: $1.80 plus transfer fee, bank cheque fee and postage as applicable. Payable if you arrange a periodical payment or ask us to transfer funds.

fees.name: Progressive Drawing Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when the Bank makes a number of progressive payments to fund your loan amount. Payable at your final drawing. Fee is applied per drawing.

fees.name: Security Guarantee Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if a guarantor is listed on the loan schedule. Fee is applied per borrower.

fees.name: Security Substitution Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you ask us to substitute one of your securities with another.

fees.name: Stop Payment Notice Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you ask us to stop payment on a cheque you have written. Fee is applied per request.

fees.name: Voucher Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $4 per voucher (minimum charge $12) or $60 per hour spent to retrieve voucher(s). Payable if you ask us to retrieve a voucher (i.e. deposit, credit or debit slips) that records a transaction on the Loan Account.

fees.name: Trust Investigation Fee
fees.additionalInfo: To be advised when we calculate the fee. Payable if we incur investigation cost for loans involving a Trust. This fee applies even if we don't give you a loan. (Refer to UTC Clause 2.1)

fees.name: Home Loan Package Fee
fees.additionalInfo: The fee is charged annually to your nominated account when you add a Wealth Package (non-broker customers only) or Mortgage Advantage (broker customers only) to your eligible home loan to access special discounts. To be eligible for a Package you must have an initial 'Package lending balance' (total of all eligible home loans and the credit limit of Viridian Line of Credit) of at least $150,000 at the time of applying.

fees.name: Lenders' Mortgage Insurance/Low Deposit Premium
fees.additionalInfo: Lenders' Mortgage Insurance (LMI) or Low Deposit Premium (LDP) may apply where there is an increased risk associated with a home loan. The circumstances of your loan determine whether a loan will incur LMI or LDP. They are a one-off cost added to the total loan amount. The LMI premium is passed on to you and is not an establishment fee. The LDP is a bank fee and not an establishment fee.

fees.name: Annual Service Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if your home loan is with the former State Bank of Victoria and the terms and conditions state the fee is required.

applicabilityConditions.additionalInfo: Package discount is assessed on the package lending balance when you apply for a package. Discount is only applicable with an active Package

detailData.name: 1 year Fixed Rate Home Loan (Investment)
detailData.description: An investment home loan where the interest rate is fixed for 1 year.

listData.name: Extra Home Loan (Owner Occupied)
listData.description: A home loan with a variable interest rate and low fees.

features.additionalInfo: Your home loan comes with a fee-free redraw facility. You can make unlimited additional repayments at any time with no fees or penalties. You can access any additional money you pay, over and above your minimum required repayment.
You can apply to top up your home loan by an additional $10,000 or more - subject to equity in your property and our approval.

Switching is a change to one or more aspects of your loan's terms and conditions, for example switching from a variable rate to a fixed rate or switching from Interest Only payments to Principal and Interest repayments. Switching to an Extra Home Loan from another CBA Home/Investment Home Loan product is subject to approval.

Ability to split your loan balance into multiple loan accounts to take advantage of both fixed and variable rate home loans. This gives you the flexibility to structure your home loan to suit your individual needs by choosing the loan amount, loan type, loan term and repayment structure for each loan.
Additional repayments can be made at any time. No fees apply.
Wherever you are in the world, CommBank gives you the choice and control to securely manage all of your accounts on a range of devices, the way you want.

A guarantor is someone who agrees to be responsible for repaying a debt owed to us under a loan provided to another individual if the borrower (or borrowers) cannot make their repayments. A guarantor supports the loan by providing us with an additional security such as their home. By providing a guarantee, we may lend to the borrower in situations where they may not have been able to secure the full amount of the loan they require.

This loan can be used for the purposes of owner occupied property purchases, refinancing your existing home loan, purchasing of vacant land (non-commercial), personal needs (e.g. home renovations, consolidation of personal debt and personal investments), off the plan purchases and building/construction purposes.
This loan cannot be used for bridging loans and business purposes.
1-30 years

detailData.description: A home loan with a variable interest rate and low fees.

listData.name: Standard Variable Rate Home Loan (Investment)
listData.description: A competitive variable rate home loan with access to offset and an extensive range of features.

features.additionalInfo: Your home loan comes with a fee-free redraw facility. You can make unlimited additional repayments at any time with no fees or penalties. You can access any additional money you pay, over and above your minimum required repayment.

An Everyday Offset account is a transaction account that's linked to your Standard Variable Rate home loan or Investment home loan. Any money you put into your Everyday Offset account (e.g. your salary and savings) - whether its $2 or $20,000 - reduces the balance on which we charge interest. This means you'll only be paying interest on the difference. You can have multiple Everyday Offset accounts linked to one home loan. Only available for individual borrowers, not companies or trusts.
You can apply to top up your home loan by an additional $10,000 or more - subject to equity in your property and our approval.

Ability to switch your loan or repayment type, for example switching from a Standard Variable Rate to a Fixed Rate home loan or switch from Principal and Interest repayments to Interest Only payments.

Ability to split your loan balance into multiple loan accounts to take advantage of both fixed and variable rate home loans. This gives you the flexibility to structure your home loan to suit your individual needs by choosing the loan amount, loan type, loan term and repayment structure for each loan.

Enjoy interest rate discounts, no establishment fees and no monthly loan service fees for eligible home loans, and a fee waiver on one eligible credit card. To receive these benefits you must qualify for the home loan Package and have an initial Package lending balance of at least $150,000 at the time of your application.
Additional repayments can be made at any time. No fees apply.
Wherever you are in the world, CommBank gives you the choice and control to securely manage all of your accounts on a range of devices, the way you want.

A guarantor is someone who agrees to be responsible for repaying a debt owed to us under a loan provided to another individual or business, if the borrower(s) can't make their repayments. A guarantor supports the loan by providing us with additional security such as a property they own. By providing a guarantee, we may lend to the borrower in situations where they may not have been able to secure the full amount on their own.

This loan can be used for the purposes of investment property purchases, refinancing your existing home loan, purchasing of vacant land (non-commercial), personal needs (e.g. home renovations, consolidation of personal debt, personal investments), off the plan purchases, bridging loan and building/construction purposes.
This loan cannot be used for business purposes
1-30 years (Subject to our approval)

constraints.additionalInfo: Minimum loan $10,000 - subject to your loan purpose, equity in your property and our approval

eligibility.additionalInfo: Non-trading Companies and/or Family/Unit/Hybrid Trusts.

Individuals must either be living in Australia as an Australian citizen, New Zealand citizen, Australian permanent resident or specified temporary Australian resident; or be an overseas citizen co-borrowing with an Australian citizen or Australian permanent resident or be living overseas as an Australian citizen or Australian permanent resident.

For home loans with new lending at 'Loan to Valuation Ratio' of 80.01% - 90%

detailData.name: Standard Variable Rate Home Loan (Investment)
detailData.description: A competitive variable rate home loan with access to offset and an extensive range of features.

listData.name: 3 year Fixed Rate Home Loan (Investment)
listData.description: An investment home loan where the interest rate is fixed for 3 years.

features.additionalInfo: Fixed Rates are subject to change up until funding. 'Rate Lock' is an optional feature that allows you to lock in your reference interest rates on new Fixed Rate Home Loan and Fixed Rate Investment Home Loan applications for 90 days for a non-refundable fee, charged per fixed rate loan account. This excludes Home Seeker applications, CommBank Green Loan applications, switching, splitting, top-ups, loan purpose transfers or repayment changes. Rate Lock can be requested any time before loan documents are issued and the reference interest rates applicable to your Rate Lock will be on the date we receive the completed Rate Lock consent from all applicants. The Rate Lock fee will be debited from your Related Account when the Rate Lock request is processed. If there are insufficient funds in that account, or the account is no longer open, then the Rate Lock fee will be charged to your home loan and your home loan will go into arrears (and fees may be charged). The 90 days commences when the Rate Lock request is processed. You can ask us to break the Rate Lock before funding (for example, if rates go down) and revert to the reference interest rates available on the funding date.

You can make additional repayments of up to $10,000 for each year of your fixed rate loan, without incurring additional charges. Excluding Interest in advance periods. Administrative Fee and an Early Repayment Adjustment (ERA) may apply. See the 'Additional repayments' section in the Fixed Rate Home Loan fact sheet for more details.

Redraw is not available during a fixed rate period. However, if you do make additional repayments during a fixed rate period, or had available redraw when you entered your fixed rate period, the redraw feature will become available at the expiry of the fixed rate. The amount available is adjusted so that at the end of your agreed loan term, both your loan balance and the available redraw will be zero.

Through a top up you can borrow an additional $10,000 or more - subject to equity held in your property and our approval. However it's important to know that a top up would break your fixed rate contract and Administrative Fee and an Early Repayment Adjustment (ERA) may apply. Please contact us to discuss this. They are not permitted during the Interest in Advance period.

Switching is a change to one or more aspects of your loan's terms and conditions, for example switching from a variable rate to a fixed rate or switching from Interest Only payments to Principal and Interest repayments. You may be charged an Administrative Fee and Early Repayment Adjustment (ERA) if you switch out of your fixed rate loan.

Splitting is when you divide one loan into two or more loan accounts, generally with different loan types, repayment types or interest rates. You may be charged an Administrative Fee and Early Repayment Adjustment (ERA) if you split your fixed rate loan.

Enjoy interest rate discounts, no establishment fees and no monthly loan service fees for eligible home loans, and a fee waiver on one eligible credit card. To receive these benefits you must qualify for the home loan Package and have an initial Package lending balance of at least $150,000 at the time of your application.
Wherever you are in the world, CommBank gives you the choice and control to securely manage all of your accounts on a range of devices, the way you want.

A guarantor is someone who agrees to be responsible for repaying a debt owed to us under a loan provided to another individual or business  if the borrower (or borrowers) cannot make their repayments. A guarantor supports the loan by providing us with an additional security such as their home. By providing a guarantee, we may lend to the borrower in situations where they may not have been able to secure the full amount of the loan they require.

This loan can be used for the purposes of investment property purchases, refinancing your existing home loan, purchasing of vacant land (non-commercial) and personal needs (e.g.home renovations, consolidation of personal debt and personal investments).
This loan cannot be used for business purposes, bridging loans, off the plan purchases and building/construction purposes

If you have a Fixed Rate Investment Home Loan with Interest Only payments, you can pay Interest 12 months in advance and there is only one interest rate option, being Interest Only rate less a 0.20% p.a. discount.
At Maturity of the fixed term, the Fixed Rate Home loan will switch to SVR Investment Home loan and the interest rate will revert to the SVR Rate applicable to your loan and repayment type.
1-30 years

constraints.additionalInfo: For a Fixed Rate Loan, there is a minimum loan amount of $10,000 for new loans.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Not available for non-personal borrowers.
Non-trading Companies and/or Family/Unit/Hybrid Trusts.

Individuals (natural persons, including as Trustee of a Family Trust) must have the legal capacity to enter into the loan contract, provide acceptable identification documentation and be 18 years or older.
Applications for home loans are subject to the Bank's normal credit approval.

Individuals must either be living in Australia as an Australian citizen, New Zealand citizen, Australian permanent resident or specified temporary Australian resident; or be an overseas citizen co-borrowing with an Australian citizen or Australian permanent resident or be living overseas as an Australian citizen or Australian permanent resident.

fees.name: Establishment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $800 establishment fee charged on off the plan purchase for new and existing home loan. $600 for each of the 1st two loans plus $300 for each additional loan charged on split loans with variable and fixed rate options. $300 establishment fee charged if you increase an existing home loan. Establishment fee is payable to cover the costs the Bank incurs in establishing your loan and unless it is waived by us, is payable at the date of settlement or funding. It does not include other fees and charges also payable at the time of entering into the loan such as those associated with the settlement of the loan or the particular circumstances of the loan.

discounts.description: Discount applies based on customer eligibility.
discounts.additionalValue: Discount applicable for customers with a home loan Package. Upfront establishment and Top Up fee waived.
discounts.additionalInfo: Not payable if you take up a home loan Package with your eligible home loan.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Must currently have or be applying for a home loan with an initial 'package lending balance' of at least $150,000 when you apply for your Home Loan Package. A Home Loan Package can be established in single or joint names or in the name of one corporate entity. It cannot be established in the name of a business or family investment trust. Trust loans can be linked to the trustee Package (personal or company) where the trustee is an applicant i.e. the borrower on the home loan.

fees.name: Loan Service Fee
fees.additionalInfo: For investment home loans, unless it is waived by us, the fee is charged monthly to each Loan Account on the repayment due date. For Interest in Advance Investment Home Loans, unless it is waived by us, the fee is charged to the Related Account monthly on the first business day of each month.

discounts.description: Discount applies based on customer eligibility.
discounts.additionalValue: Discount applicable for customers with a home loan Package. The Loan Service Fee is waived every month while your eligible home loan participates in a home loan Package.
discounts.additionalInfo: Not payable if you take up a home loan Package with your eligible home loan.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Must currently have or be applying for a home loan with an initial 'package lending balance' of at least $150,000 when you apply for your Home Loan Package. A Home Loan Package can be established in single or joint names or in the name of one corporate entity. It cannot be established in the name of a business or family investment trust. Trust loans can be linked to the trustee Package (personal or company) where the trustee is an applicant i.e. the borrower on the home loan.

fees.name: Rate Lock Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $750 per Rate Lock. Payable if you elect to lock in your interest rates and is charged when we set up your home loan or when your rate lock request is processed (if requested later). This non-refundable fee applies to 1-5 Year Fixed Rate home loans only. We will lock in the interest rates from when we receive your completed rate lock form and will end 90 days after we process your rate lock request. Fee applies per rate lock.

fees.name: Settlement Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $150 if the disclosure date in the contract is before 03/02/12. Payable regardless of whether we attend settlement or not, when the Bank or our representatives, arranges the funding of the loan.

fees.name: Settlement Cheque Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you require additional cheques (more than two) to fund / settle the loan. Fee applied per cheque.

fees.name: Late Payment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: For home loans - If your account falls into arrears, you will be charged a late payment fee. This fee is payable on the fifth business day after the monthly repayment due date. We will continue to charge the fee monthly until you repay all arrears or you enter into an arrangement with us for the full repayment of those arrears (even if you repay your loan weekly or fortnightly). If you break that arrangement the fee will continue to apply.

fees.name: Settlement Fee (Discharge)
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you discharge the loan, i.e. either sell part or all of the Security Property or refinance your Loan with another credit provider.

fees.name: Administrative Fee
fees.additionalInfo: An Administrative fee is payable if you repay your home loan in full before the fixed interest rate period expires; or make partial prepayments which exceed $10,000 in any year of your fixed rate loan.

fees.name: Early Repayment Adjustment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: An Early Repayment Adjustment is payable if you make partial prepayments on a fixed rate loan which exceed $10,000 in any year of your fixed rate loan (including paying the loan off in full); or make full prepayment during a capped or one-year guaranteed rate period of a home loan; or switch your Fixed Rate loan before the selected fixed or guaranteed rate period expires; or Top up the amount of credit of a home loan during a fixed or guaranteed rate period.

fees.name: Additional Security Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if we require you to provide more than one security (i.e. the security used to support the repayment of the loan), and one or more of these securities is 'new' i.e. does not already secure another loan. Fee is applied  per 'new' security.

fees.name: Periodical Payments or Transfers
fees.additionalInfo: $1.80 plus transfer fee, bank cheque fee and postage as applicable. Payable if you arrange a periodical payment or ask us to transfer funds.

fees.name: Progressive Drawing Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when the Bank makes a number of progressive payments to fund your loan amount. Payable at your final drawing. Fee is applied per drawing.

fees.name: Security Guarantee Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if a guarantor is listed on the loan schedule. Fee is applied per borrower.

fees.name: Security Substitution Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you ask us to substitute one of your securities with another.

fees.name: Stop Payment Notice Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you ask us to stop payment on a cheque you have written. Fee is applied per request.

fees.name: Voucher Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $4 per voucher (minimum charge $12) or $60 per hour spent to retrieve voucher(s). Payable if you ask us to retrieve a voucher (i.e. deposit, credit or debit slips) that records a transaction on the Loan Account.

fees.name: Trust Investigation Fee
fees.additionalInfo: To be advised when we calculate the fee. Payable if we incur investigation cost for loans involving a Trust. This fee applies even if we don't give you a loan. (Refer to UTC Clause 2.1)

fees.name: Home Loan Package Fee
fees.additionalInfo: The fee is charged annually to your nominated account when you add a Wealth Package (non-broker customers only) or Mortgage Advantage (broker customers only) to your eligible home loan to access special discounts. To be eligible for a Package you must have an initial 'Package lending balance' (total of all eligible home loans and the credit limit of Viridian Line of Credit) of at least $150,000 at the time of applying.

fees.name: Lenders' Mortgage Insurance/Low Deposit Premium
fees.additionalInfo: Lenders' Mortgage Insurance (LMI) or Low Deposit Premium (LDP) may apply where there is an increased risk associated with a home loan. The circumstances of your loan determine whether a loan will incur LMI or LDP. They are a one-off cost added to the total loan amount. The LMI premium is passed on to you and is not an establishment fee. The LDP is a bank fee and not an establishment fee.

fees.name: Annual Service Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if your home loan is with the former State Bank of Victoria and the terms and conditions state the fee is required.

listData.name: CommBank Green Loan
listData.description: Customers with an eligible CommBank home loan or investment home loan can use the Green Loan to buy and install eligible energy-efficient products such as solar panels, solar/heat pump hot water systems or battery packs, electric vehicle charging stations, switching from gas to electric cooking equipment, enabling components to support solar PV and batteries, smart/connected home products, energy efficient window treatments, switching from non LED to LED lighting and virtual power plants at the property used to secure their eligible CommBank home loan.

features.additionalValue: No Early Repayment Adjustment or Administrative fees
features.additionalInfo: There is no Early Repayment Adjustment (ERA) or Administrative Fee applied if you break the fixed interest rate period by paying your loan partially or in full.
10 years. You have the certainty of knowing exactly what your repayments will be – giving you the confidence to budget accurately and plan ahead.
Wherever you are in the world, CommBank gives you the choice and control to securely manage all of your accounts on a range of devices, the way you want.

Installation of eligible energy-efficient products must be completed by an approved New Energy Tech retailer and the installer must be accredited with Solar Accreditation Australia to make sure systems meet industry best practice standards and all relevant Australian Standards (as approved by the New Energy Tech Consumer Code).

A CommBank Green Loan is not available if your eligible new and/or existing home loan is or has any of the following features: Bridging loans, Equity Unlock for Seniors (EQFS) , Non-personal borrower(s) such as a Company and/or Trust, or Loans under government guarantee scheme.

constraints.additionalInfo: For a Green Loan, there is a minimum loan amount of $5,000.
For a Green Loan, there is a maximum loan amount of $30,000.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Individuals (natural persons) must have the legal capacity to enter into the loan contract, provide acceptable identification documentation and be 18 years or older.
Applications for home loans are subject to the Bank's normal credit approval.

eligibility.additionalValue: Hold eligible CommBank Home loan or CommBank Investment Home Loan
eligibility.additionalInfo: Eligible borrower(s) must have an eligible CommBank Home Loan or CommBank Investment Home Loan funded which is not currently being used for bridging purposes, be an Equity Unlock for Seniors loan or be under a government guarantee scheme. The eligible CommBank Home or CommBank Investment Home Loan must have a total CBA home loan balance of $150,000 or more at the time the CommBank Green Loan is funded (not including any redraw balances, loans for bridging purposes, Viridian Line of Credit limits, Equity Unlock for Seniors loan or the new CommBank Green Loan). Eligible CommBank Home Loan or CommBank Investment Home Loan and the CommBank Green Loan must be secured by the property where the CommBank Green Loan will be used to install the energy-efficient assets and is not a commercial property. The address for installation must match the address we have listed as security for at least one of your eligible CommBank home loan(s) and your total lending balance (Home/Investment Home Loans and CommBank Green Loans/CommBank Investment Green Loans) must not exceed 80% of the security property's value (subject to any postcode restrictions).

eligibility.additionalValue: Install eligible energy-efficient products on the property
eligibility.additionalInfo: The CommBank Green Loan must be used to install eligible energy-efficient products on the property used to secure the existing home loan such as solar panels, solar/heat pump hot water systems or battery packs, electric vehicle charging stations, switching from gas to electric cooking equipment, enabling components to support solar PV and batteries, smart/connected home products, energy efficient window treatments, switching from non LED to LED lighting and virtual power plants.

Installation of eligible energy-efficient products must be completed by an approved New Energy Tech retailer and the installer must be accredited with Solar Accreditation Australia to make sure systems meet industry best practice standards and all relevant Australian Standards (as approved by the New Energy Tech Consumer Code).
The borrower(s) on the CommBank Green Loan must be the borrower(s) name on the CommBank home loan.

fees.name: Late Payment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: For home loans - If your account falls into arrears, you will be charged a late payment fee. The fee is payable on the fifth business day after the monthly repayment due date. We will continue to charge the fee monthly until you repay all arrears or you enter into an arrangement with us for the full repayment of those arrears (even if you repay your loan weekly or fortnightly). If you break that arrangement the fee will continue to apply.

We will continue to charge the fee monthly until you repay all arrears or you enter into an arrangement with us for the full repayment of those arrears (even if you repay your loan weekly or fortnightly). If you break that arrangement the fee will continue to apply.

fees.name: Settlement Fee (Discharge)
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you discharge the loan, i.e. either sell part or all of the Security Property or refinance your Loan with another credit provider.

fees.name: Administrative Fee
fees.additionalInfo: An Administrative fee is payable if you repay your home loan in full before the fixed interest rate period expires; or make partial prepayments which exceed $10,000 in any year of your fixed rate loan.

fees.name: Early Repayment Adjustment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: An Early Repayment Adjustment is payable if you make partial prepayments on a fixed rate loan which exceed $10,000 in any year of your fixed rate loan (including paying the loan off in full); or make full prepayment during a capped or one-year guaranteed rate period of a home loan; or switch your Fixed Rate loan before the selected fixed or guaranteed rate period expires; or Top up the amount of credit of a home loan during a fixed or guaranteed rate period.

fees.name: Additional Security Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if we require you to provide more than one security (i.e. the security used to support the repayment of the loan), and one or more of these securities is 'new' i.e. does not already secure another loan. Fee is applied  per 'new' security.

fees.name: Periodical Payments or Transfers
fees.additionalInfo: $1.80 plus transfer fee, bank cheque fee and postage as applicable. Payable if you arrange a periodical payment or ask us to transfer funds.

fees.name: Progressive Drawing Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when the Bank makes a number of progressive payments to fund your loan amount. Payable at your final drawing. Fee is applied per drawing.

fees.name: Security Guarantee Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if a guarantor is listed on the loan schedule. Fee is applied per borrower.

fees.name: Security Substitution Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you ask us to substitute one of your securities with another.

fees.name: Stop Payment Notice Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you ask us to stop payment on a cheque you have written. Fee is applied per request.

fees.name: Voucher Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $4 per voucher (minimum charge $12) or $60 per hour spent to retrieve voucher(s). Payable if you ask us to retrieve a voucher (i.e. deposit, credit or debit slips) that records a transaction on the Loan Account.

fees.name: Trust Investigation Fee
fees.additionalInfo: To be advised when we calculate the fee. Payable if we incur investigation cost for loans involving a Trust. This fee applies even if we don't give you a loan. (Refer to UTC Clause 2.1)

fees.name: Home Loan Package Fee
fees.additionalInfo: The fee is charged annually to your nominated account when you add a Wealth Package (non-broker customers only) or Mortgage Advantage (broker customers only) to your eligible home loan to access special discounts. To be eligible for a Package you must have an initial 'Package lending balance' (total of all eligible home loans and the credit limit of Viridian Line of Credit) of at least $150,000 at the time of applying.

fees.name: Lenders' Mortgage Insurance/Low Deposit Premium
fees.additionalInfo: Lenders' Mortgage Insurance (LMI) or Low Deposit Premium (LDP) may apply where there is an increased risk associated with a home loan. The circumstances of your loan determine whether a loan will incur LMI or LDP. They are a one-off cost added to the total loan amount. The LMI premium is passed on to you and is not an establishment fee. The LDP is a bank fee and not an establishment fee.

fees.name: Annual Service Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if your home loan is with the former State Bank of Victoria and the terms and conditions state the fee is required.

applicabilityConditions.additionalInfo: Package discount is assessed on the package lending balance when you apply for a package. Discount is only applicable with an active Package

features.additionalInfo: You can make unlimited additional repayments (including the ability to pay the loan out early) without additional charge.
Unlimited fee free redraw when done online through CommBank App or NetBank.

You can switch your loan or repayment type, for example switching from a Digi Home Loan to a Standard Variable Rate or a Fixed Rate home loan or switch from Principal and Interest repayments to Interest Only payments.
Wherever you are in the world, CommBank gives you the choice and control to securely manage all of your accounts on a range of devices, the way you want.
Easily apply in minutes and download the CommBank app to proceed and manage your home loan online.
This loan can be used for purposes of refinance or home renovations, consolidation of personal debt, personal needs and personal investments other than cryptocurrency or digital assets.
This loan cannot be used for business purposes, owner occupied or investment property purchase, off the plan purchases, purchase of land, building and construction loans or bridging loans.

An Everyday Offset account is a transaction account that's linked to your Digi Home Loan or Investment home loan. Any money you put into your Everyday Offset account (e.g.  your salary and savings) - whether its $2 or $20,000 - reduces the balance on which we charge interest. This means you'll only be paying interest on the difference. You can have up to one Everyday Offset account linked to one Digi Home Loan. A monthly Offset Feature fee applies. Only available for individual borrowers, not companies or trusts.

constraints.additionalInfo: Minimum $1,000 withdrawal with a $15 Redraw fee payable if you ask us via phone or in branch to support you with accessing your Additional Repayments. This fee is waived until 30 June 2025. There is no minimum withdrawal amount when accessing redraw electronically and no fee.
Minimum loan amount for new loans.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Available to Individuals only (Companies and/or Family/Unit/Hybrid Trusts are excluded).
Individuals must be 18 years of age or above
Customers must have a loan to value ratio of no more than 80% (i.e. at least a 20% deposit), unless postcode restrictions apply which may require a higher deposit amount.
Customers are comfortable to self-serve online, submit their Digi Home Loan application via online channels (e.g. NetBank and CommBank app), and use the CommBank app to complete the application.
CBA home loan customers cannot switch or internally re-finance into a digital home loan product.
Available only for customers refinancing their loan from another financial institution to CommBank.

Or an individual living and working overseas as an Australian citizen or permanent resident.

We will continue to charge the fee monthly until you repay all arrears or you enter into an arrangement with us for the full repayment of those arrears (even if you repay your loan weekly or fortnightly). fees.name: Paper Statement Fee

fees.name: Redraw Fee

fees.name: Offset Feature fee

detailData.name: Digi Home Loan (Owner Occupied)
detailData.description: A digital home loan with a low variable rate

listData.name: 1 Year Fixed Rate Home Loan (Owner Occupied)
listData.description: An owner occupied home loan where the interest rate is fixed for 1 year.

features.additionalInfo: Fixed Rates are subject to change up until funding. 'Rate Lock' is an optional feature that allows you to lock in your reference interest rates on new Fixed Rate Home Loan and Fixed Rate Investment Home Loan applications for 90 days for a non-refundable fee, charged per fixed rate loan account. This excludes Home Seeker applications, CommBank Green Loan applications, switching, splitting, top-ups, loan purpose transfers or repayment changes. Rate Lock can be requested any time before loan documents are issued and the reference interest rates applicable to your Rate Lock will be on the date we receive the completed Rate Lock consent from all applicants. The Rate Lock fee will be debited from your Related Account when the Rate Lock request is processed. If there are insufficient funds in that account, or the account is no longer open, then the Rate Lock fee will be charged to your home loan and your home loan will go into arrears (and fees may be charged). The 90 days commences when the Rate Lock request is processed. You can ask us to break the Rate Lock before funding (for example, if rates go down) and revert to the reference interest rates available on the funding date.

You can make additional repayments of up to $10,000 for each year of your fixed rate loan, without incurring additional charges. Excluding Interest in advance periods. Administrative Fee and an Early Repayment Adjustment (ERA) may apply. See the 'Additional repayments' section in the Fixed Rate Home Loan fact sheet for more details.

Redraw is not available during a fixed rate period. However, if you do make additional repayments during a fixed rate period, or had available redraw when you entered your fixed rate period, the redraw feature will become available at the expiry of the fixed rate. The amount available is adjusted so that at the end of your agreed loan term, both your loan balance and the available redraw will be zero.

Through a top up you can borrow an additional $10,000 or more - subject to equity held in your property and our approval. However it's important to know that a top up would break your fixed rate contract and Administrative Fee and an Early Repayment Adjustment (ERA) may apply. Please contact us to discuss this. They are not permitted during the Interest in Advance period.

Switching is a change to one or more aspects of your loan's terms and conditions, for example switching from a variable rate to a fixed rate or switching from Interest Only payments to Principal and Interest repayments. You may be charged an Administrative Fee and Early Repayment Adjustment if you switch out of your fixed rate loan.

Splitting is when you divide one loan into two or more loan accounts, generally with different loan types, repayment types or interest rates. You may be charged an Early Repayment Adjustment fee if you split your fixed rate loan.

Enjoy interest rate discounts, no establishment fees and no monthly loan service fees for eligible home loans, and a fee waiver on one eligible credit card. To receive these benefits you must qualify for the home loan Package and have an initial Package lending balance of at least $150,000 at the time of your application.
Wherever you are in the world, CommBank gives you the choice and control to securely manage all of your accounts on a range of devices, the way you want.

A guarantor is someone who agrees to be responsible for repaying a debt owed to us under a loan provided to another individual or business  if the borrower (or borrowers) cannot make their repayments. A guarantor supports the loan by providing us with an additional security such as their home. By providing a guarantee, we may lend to the borrower in situations where they may not have been able to secure the full amount of the loan they require.

This loan can be used for the purposes of owner occupied property purchases, refinancing your existing home loan, purchasing of vacant land (non-commercial) and personal needs (e.g. home renovations, consolidation of personal debt and personal investments).
This loan cannot be used for business purposes, bridging loans, off the plan purchases and building/construction purposes
At Maturity of the fixed term, the Fixed Rate Home loan will switch to SVR Home loan and the interest rate will revert to the SVR Rate applicable to your loan and repayment type.
1-30 years

constraints.additionalInfo: For a Fixed Rate Loan, there is a minimum loan amount of $10,000 for new loans.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Non-trading Companies and/or Family/Unit/Hybrid Trusts.

Individuals (natural persons, including as Trustee of a Family Trust) must have the legal capacity to enter into the loan contract, provide acceptable identification documentation and be 18 years or older.
Applications for home loans are subject to the Bank's normal credit approval.

Individuals must either be living in Australia as an Australian citizen, New Zealand citizen, Australian permanent resident or specified temporary Australian resident; or be an overseas citizen co-borrowing with an Australian citizen or Australian permanent resident or be living overseas as an Australian citizen or Australian permanent resident.

fees.name: Establishment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $800 establishment fee charged on off the plan purchase for new and existing home loan. $600 for each of the 1st two loans plus $300 for each additional loan charged on split loans with variable and fixed rate options. $300 establishment fee charged if you increase an existing home loan. Establishment fee is payable to cover the costs the Bank incurs in establishing your loan and unless it is waived by us, is payable at the date of settlement or funding. It does not include other fees and charges also payable at the time of entering into the loan such as those associated with the settlement of the loan or the particular circumstances of the loan.

The 90 days commences when the Rate Lock request is processed. You can ask us to break the Rate Lock before funding (for example, if rates go down) and revert to the reference interest rates available on the funding date.

You can make additional repayments of up to $10,000 for each year of your fixed rate loan, without incurring additional charges. Excluding Interest in advance periods. Administrative Fee and an Early Repayment Adjustment (ERA) may apply. See the 'Additional repayments' section in the Fixed Rate Home Loan fact sheet for more details.

Redraw is not available during a fixed rate period. However, if you do make additional repayments during a fixed rate period, or had available redraw when you entered your fixed rate period, the redraw feature will become available at the expiry of the fixed rate. The amount available is adjusted so that at the end of your agreed loan term, both your loan balance and the available redraw will be zero.

Through a top up you can borrow an additional $10,000 or more - subject to equity held in your property and our approval. However it's important to know that a top up would break your fixed rate contract and Administrative Fee and an Early Repayment Adjustment (ERA) may apply. Please contact us to discuss this. They are not permitted during the Interest in Advance period.

Switching is a change to one or more aspects of your loan's terms and conditions, for example switching from a variable rate to a fixed rate or switching from Interest Only payments to Principal and Interest repayments. You may be charged an Administrative Fee and Early Repayment Adjustment (ERA) if you switch out of your fixed rate loan.

Splitting is when you divide one loan into two or more loan accounts, generally with different loan types, repayment types or interest rates. You may be charged an Administrative Fee and Early Repayment Adjustment (ERA) if you split your fixed rate loan.

Enjoy interest rate discounts, no establishment fees and no monthly loan service fees for eligible home loans, and a fee waiver on one eligible credit card. To receive these benefits you must qualify for the home loan Package and have an initial Package lending balance of at least $150,000 at the time of your application.
Wherever you are in the world, CommBank gives you the choice and control to securely manage all of your accounts on a range of devices, the way you want.

A guarantor is someone who agrees to be responsible for repaying a debt owed to us under a loan provided to another individual or business  if the borrower (or borrowers) cannot make their repayments. A guarantor supports the loan by providing us with an additional security such as their home. By providing a guarantee, we may lend to the borrower in situations where they may not have been able to secure the full amount of the loan they require.

This loan can be used for the purposes of investment property purchases, refinancing your existing home loan, purchasing of vacant land (non-commercial) and personal needs (e.g.home renovations, consolidation of personal debt and personal investments).
This loan cannot be used for business purposes, bridging loans, off the plan purchases and building/construction purposes

If you have a Fixed Rate Investment Home Loan with Interest Only payments, you can pay Interest 12 months in advance and there is only one interest rate option, being Interest Only rate less a 0.20% p.a. discount.
At Maturity of the fixed term, the Fixed Rate Home loan will switch to SVR Investment Home loan and the interest rate will revert to the SVR Rate applicable to your loan and repayment type.
1-30 years

constraints.additionalInfo: For a Fixed Rate Loan, there is a minimum loan amount of $10,000 for new loans.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Not available for non-personal borrowers.
Non-trading Companies and/or Family/Unit/Hybrid Trusts.

Individuals (natural persons, including as Trustee of a Family Trust) must have the legal capacity to enter into the loan contract, provide acceptable identification documentation and be 18 years or older.
Applications for home loans are subject to the Bank's normal credit approval.

Individuals must either be living in Australia as an Australian citizen, New Zealand citizen, Australian permanent resident or specified temporary Australian resident; or be an overseas citizen co-borrowing with an Australian citizen or Australian permanent resident or be living overseas as an Australian citizen or Australian permanent resident.

fees.name: Establishment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $800 establishment fee charged on off the plan purchase for new and existing home loan. $600 for each of the 1st two loans plus $300 for each additional loan charged on split loans with variable and fixed rate options. $300 establishment fee charged if you increase an existing home loan. Establishment fee is payable to cover the costs the Bank incurs in establishing your loan and unless it is waived by us, is payable at the date of settlement or funding. It does not include other fees and charges also payable at the time of entering into the loan such as those associated with the settlement of the loan or the particular circumstances of the loan.

discounts.description: Discount applies based on customer eligibility.
discounts.additionalValue: Discount applicable for customers with a home loan Package. Upfront establishment and Top Up fee waived.
discounts.additionalInfo: Not payable if you take up a home loan Package with your eligible home loan.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Must currently have or be applying for a home loan with an initial 'package lending balance' of at least $150,000 when you apply for your Home Loan Package. A Home Loan Package can be established in single or joint names or in the name of one corporate entity. It cannot be established in the name of a business or family investment trust. Trust loans can be linked to the trustee Package (personal or company) where the trustee is an applicant i.e. the borrower on the home loan.

fees.name: Loan Service Fee
fees.additionalInfo: For investment home loans, unless it is waived by us, the fee is charged monthly to each Loan Account on the repayment due date. For Interest in Advance Investment Home Loans, unless it is waived by us, the fee is charged to the Related Account monthly on the first business day of each month.

discounts.description: Discount applies based on customer eligibility.
discounts.additionalValue: Discount applicable for customers with a home loan Package. The Loan Service Fee is waived every month while your eligible home loan participates in a home loan Package.
discounts.additionalInfo: Not payable if you take up a home loan Package with your eligible home loan.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Must currently have or be applying for a home loan with an initial 'package lending balance' of at least $150,000 when you apply for your Home Loan Package. A Home Loan Package can be established in single or joint names or in the name of one corporate entity. It cannot be established in the name of a business or family investment trust. Trust loans can be linked to the trustee Package (personal or company) where the trustee is an applicant i.e. the borrower on the home loan.

fees.name: Rate Lock Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $750 per Rate Lock. Payable if you elect to lock in your interest rates and is charged when we set up your home loan or when your rate lock request is processed (if requested later). This non-refundable fee applies to 1-5 Year Fixed Rate home loans only. We will lock in the interest rates from when we receive your completed rate lock form and will end 90 days after we process your rate lock request. Fee applies per rate lock.

fees.name: Settlement Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $150 if the disclosure date in the contract is before 03/02/12. Payable regardless of whether we attend settlement or not, when the Bank or our representatives, arranges the funding of the loan.

fees.name: Settlement Cheque Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you require additional cheques (more than two) to fund / settle the loan. Fee applied per cheque.

fees.name: Late Payment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: For home loans - If your account falls into arrears, you will be charged a late payment fee. This fee is payable on the fifth business day after the monthly repayment due date. We will continue to charge the fee monthly until you repay all arrears or you enter into an arrangement with us for the full repayment of those arrears (even if you repay your loan weekly or fortnightly). If you break that arrangement the fee will continue to apply.

fees.name: Settlement Fee (Discharge)
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you discharge the loan, i.e. either sell part or all of the Security Property or refinance your Loan with another credit provider.

fees.name: Administrative Fee
fees.additionalInfo: An Administrative fee is payable if you repay your home loan in full before the fixed interest rate period expires; or make partial prepayments which exceed $10,000 in any year of your fixed rate loan.

fees.name: Early Repayment Adjustment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: An Early Repayment Adjustment is payable if you make partial prepayments on a fixed rate loan which exceed $10,000 in any year of your fixed rate loan (including paying the loan off in full); or make full prepayment during a capped or one-year guaranteed rate period of a home loan; or switch your Fixed Rate loan before the selected fixed or guaranteed rate period expires; or Top up the amount of credit of a home loan during a fixed or guaranteed rate period.

fees.name: Additional Security Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if we require you to provide more than one security (i.e. the security used to support the repayment of the loan), and one or more of these securities is 'new' i.e. does not already secure another loan. Fee is applied  per 'new' security.

fees.name: Periodical Payments or Transfers
fees.additionalInfo: $1.80 plus transfer fee, bank cheque fee and postage as applicable. Payable if you arrange a periodical payment or ask us to transfer funds.

fees.name: Progressive Drawing Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when the Bank makes a number of progressive payments to fund your loan amount. Payable at your final drawing. Fee is applied per drawing.

fees.name: Security Guarantee Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if a guarantor is listed on the loan schedule. Fee is applied per borrower.

fees.name: Security Substitution Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you ask us to substitute one of your securities with another.

fees.name: Stop Payment Notice Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you ask us to stop payment on a cheque you have written. Fee is applied per request.

fees.name: Voucher Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $4 per voucher (minimum charge $12) or $60 per hour spent to retrieve voucher(s). Payable if you ask us to retrieve a voucher (i.e. deposit, credit or debit slips) that records a transaction on the Loan Account.

fees.name: Trust Investigation Fee
fees.additionalInfo: To be advised when we calculate the fee. Payable if we incur investigation cost for loans involving a Trust. This fee applies even if we don't give you a loan. (Refer to UTC Clause 2.1)

fees.name: Home Loan Package Fee
fees.additionalInfo: The fee is charged annually to your nominated account when you add a Wealth Package (non-broker customers only) or Mortgage Advantage (broker customers only) to your eligible home loan to access special discounts. To be eligible for a Package you must have an initial 'Package lending balance' (total of all eligible home loans and the credit limit of Viridian Line of Credit) of at least $150,000 at the time of applying.

fees.name: Lenders' Mortgage Insurance/Low Deposit Premium
fees.additionalInfo: Lenders' Mortgage Insurance (LMI) or Low Deposit Premium (LDP) may apply where there is an increased risk associated with a home loan. The circumstances of your loan determine whether a loan will incur LMI or LDP. They are a one-off cost added to the total loan amount. The LMI premium is passed on to you and is not an establishment fee. The LDP is a bank fee and not an establishment fee.

fees.name: Annual Service Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if your home loan is with the former State Bank of Victoria and the terms and conditions state the fee is required.

lendingRates.additionalInfo: Investment - Principal and Interest repayment type

applicabilityConditions.additionalInfo: Package discount is assessed on the package lending balance when you apply for a package. Discount is only applicable with an active Package

A Home Loan Package can be established in single or joint names or in the name of one corporate entity. It cannot be established in the name of a business or family investment trust. Trust loans can be linked to the trustee Package (personal or company) where the trustee is an applicant i.e. the borrower on the home loan.

fees.name: Rate Lock Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $750 per Rate Lock. Payable if you elect to lock in your interest rates and is charged when we set up your home loan or when your rate lock request is processed (if requested later). This non-refundable fee applies to 1-5 Year Fixed Rate home loans only. We will lock in the interest rates from when we receive your completed rate lock form and will end 90 days after we process your rate lock request. Fee applies per rate lock.

fees.name: Settlement Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $150 if the disclosure date in the contract is before 03/02/12. Payable regardless of whether we attend settlement or not, when the Bank or our representatives, arranges the funding of the loan.

fees.name: Settlement Cheque Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you require additional cheques (more than two) to fund / settle the loan. Fee applied per cheque.

fees.name: Late Payment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: For home loans - If your account falls into arrears, you will be charged a late payment fee. This fee is payable on the fifth business day after the monthly repayment due date. We will continue to charge the fee monthly until you repay all arrears or you enter into an arrangement with us for the full repayment of those arrears (even if you repay your loan weekly or fortnightly). If you break that arrangement the fee will continue to apply.

fees.name: Settlement Fee (Discharge)
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you discharge the loan, i.e. either sell part or all of the Security Property or refinance your Loan with another credit provider.

fees.name: Administrative Fee
fees.additionalInfo: An Administrative fee is payable if you repay your home loan in full before the fixed interest rate period expires; or make partial prepayments which exceed $10,000 in any year of your fixed rate loan.

fees.name: Early Repayment Adjustment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: An Early Repayment Adjustment is payable if you make partial prepayments on a fixed rate loan which exceed $10,000 in any year of your fixed rate loan (including paying the loan off in full); or make full prepayment during a capped or one-year guaranteed rate period of a home loan; or switch your Fixed Rate loan before the selected fixed or guaranteed rate period expires; or Top up the amount of credit of a home loan during a fixed or guaranteed rate period.

fees.name: Additional Security Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if we require you to provide more than one security (i.e. the security used to support the repayment of the loan), and one or more of these securities is 'new' i.e. does not already secure another loan. Fee is applied  per 'new' security.

fees.name: Periodical Payments or Transfers
fees.additionalInfo: $1.80 plus transfer fee, bank cheque fee and postage as applicable. Payable if you arrange a periodical payment or ask us to transfer funds.

fees.name: Progressive Drawing Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable when the Bank makes a number of progressive payments to fund your loan amount. Payable at your final drawing. Fee is applied per drawing.

fees.name: Security Guarantee Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if a guarantor is listed on the loan schedule. Fee is applied per borrower.

fees.name: Security Substitution Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you ask us to substitute one of your securities with another.

fees.name: Stop Payment Notice Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if you ask us to stop payment on a cheque you have written. Fee is applied per request.

fees.name: Voucher Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $4 per voucher (minimum charge $12) or $60 per hour spent to retrieve voucher(s). Payable if you ask us to retrieve a voucher (i.e. deposit, credit or debit slips) that records a transaction on the Loan Account.

fees.name: Trust Investigation Fee
fees.additionalInfo: To be advised when we calculate the fee. Payable if we incur investigation cost for loans involving a Trust. This fee applies even if we don't give you a loan. (Refer to UTC Clause 2.1)

fees.name: Home Loan Package Fee
fees.additionalInfo: The fee is charged annually to your nominated account when you add a Wealth Package (non-broker customers only) or Mortgage Advantage (broker customers only) to your eligible home loan to access special discounts. To be eligible for a Package you must have an initial 'Package lending balance' (total of all eligible home loans and the credit limit of Viridian Line of Credit) of at least $150,000 at the time of applying.

fees.name: Lenders' Mortgage Insurance/Low Deposit Premium
fees.additionalInfo: Lenders' Mortgage Insurance (LMI) or Low Deposit Premium (LDP) may apply where there is an increased risk associated with a home loan. The circumstances of your loan determine whether a loan will incur LMI or LDP. They are a one-off cost added to the total loan amount. The LMI premium is passed on to you and is not an establishment fee. The LDP is a bank fee and not an establishment fee.

fees.name: Annual Service Fee
fees.additionalInfo: Payable if your home loan is with the former State Bank of Victoria and the terms and conditions state the fee is required.

detailData.name: 2 Year Fixed Rate Home Loan (Owner Occupied)
detailData.description: An owner occupied home loan where the interest rate is fixed for 2 years.

listData.name: 5 Year Fixed Rate Loan (Owner Occupied)
listData.description: An owner occupied home loan where the interest rate is fixed for 5 years.

features.additionalInfo: Fixed Rates are subject to change up until funding. 'Rate Lock' is an optional feature that allows you to lock in your reference interest rates on new Fixed Rate Home Loan and Fixed Rate Investment Home Loan applications for 90 days for a non-refundable fee, charged per fixed rate loan account. This excludes Home Seeker applications, CommBank Green Loan applications, switching, splitting, top-ups, loan purpose transfers or repayment changes. Rate Lock can be requested any time before loan documents are issued and the reference interest rates applicable to your Rate Lock will be on the date we receive the completed Rate Lock consent from all applicants. The Rate Lock fee will be debited from your Related Account when the Rate Lock request is processed. If there are insufficient funds in that account, or the account is no longer open, then the Rate Lock fee will be charged to your home loan and your home loan will go into arrears (and fees may be charged). The 90 days commences when the Rate Lock request is processed. You can ask us to break the Rate Lock before funding (for example, if rates go down) and revert to the reference interest rates available on the funding date.

You can make additional repayments of up to $10,000 for each year of your fixed rate loan, without incurring additional charges. Excluding Interest in advance periods. Administrative Fee and an Early Repayment Adjustment (ERA) may apply. See the 'Additional repayments' section in the Fixed Rate Home Loan fact sheet for more details.

Redraw is not available during a fixed rate period. However, if you do make additional repayments during a fixed rate period, or had available redraw when you entered your fixed rate period, the redraw feature will become available at the expiry of the fixed rate. The amount available is adjusted so that at the end of your agreed loan term, both your loan balance and the available redraw will be zero.

Through a top up you can borrow an additional $10,000 or more - subject to equity held in your property and our approval. However it's important to know that a top up would break your fixed rate contract and Administrative Fee and an Early Repayment Adjustment (ERA) may apply. Please contact us to discuss this. They are not permitted during the Interest in Advance period.

Switching is a change to one or more aspects of your loan's terms and conditions, for example switching from a variable rate to a fixed rate or switching from Interest Only payments to Principal and Interest repayments. You may be charged an Administrative Fee and Early Repayment Adjustment if you switch out of your fixed rate loan.

Splitting is when you divide one loan into two or more loan accounts, generally with different loan types, repayment types or interest rates. You may be charged an Early Repayment Adjustment fee if you split your fixed rate loan.

Enjoy interest rate discounts, no establishment fees and no monthly loan service fees for eligible home loans, and a fee waiver on one eligible credit card. To receive these benefits you must qualify for the home loan Package and have an initial Package lending balance of at least $150,000 at the time of your application.
Wherever you are in the world, CommBank gives you the choice and control to securely manage all of your accounts on a range of devices, the way you want.

A guarantor is someone who agrees to be responsible for repaying a debt owed to us under a loan provided to another individual or business  if the borrower (or borrowers) cannot make their repayments. A guarantor supports the loan by providing us with an additional security such as their home. By providing a guarantee, we may lend to the borrower in situations where they may not have been able to secure the full amount of the loan they require.

This loan can be used for the purposes of owner occupied property purchases, refinancing your existing home loan, purchasing of vacant land (non-commercial) and personal needs (e.g. home renovations, consolidation of personal debt and personal investments).
This loan cannot be used for business purposes, bridging loans, off the plan purchases and building/construction purposes
At Maturity of the fixed term, the Fixed Rate Home loan will switch to SVR Home loan and the interest rate will revert to the SVR Rate applicable to your loan and repayment type.
1-30 years

constraints.additionalInfo: For a Fixed Rate Loan, there is a minimum loan amount of $10,000 for new loans.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Non-trading Companies and/or Family/Unit/Hybrid Trusts.

Individuals (natural persons, including as Trustee of a Family Trust) must have the legal capacity to enter into the loan contract, provide acceptable identification documentation and be 18 years or older.
Applications for home loans are subject to the Bank's normal credit approval.

Individuals must either be living in Australia as an Australian citizen, New Zealand citizen, Australian permanent resident or specified temporary Australian resident; or be an overseas citizen co-borrowing with an Australian citizen or Australian permanent resident or be living overseas as an Australian citizen or Australian permanent resident.

fees.additionalInfo: $800 establishment fee charged on off the plan purchase for new and existing home loan. $600 for each of the 1st two loans plus $300 for each additional loan charged on split loans with variable and fixed rate options. $300 establishment fee charged if you increase an existing home loan. Establishment fee is payable to cover the costs the Bank incurs in establishing your loan and unless it is waived by us, is payable at the date of settlement or funding. It does not include other fees and charges also payable at the time of entering into the loan such as those associated with the settlement of the loan or the particular circumstances of the loan.

detailData.name: 5 Year Fixed Rate Loan (Owner Occupied)
detailData.description: An owner occupied home loan where the interest rate is fixed for 5 years.

listData.name: Standard Variable Rate Home Loan (Owner Occupied)
listData.description: A competitive variable rate home loan with access to offset and an extensive range of features.

features.additionalInfo: Your home loan comes with a fee-free redraw facility. You can make unlimited additional repayments at any time with no fees or penalties. You can access any additional money you pay, over and above your minimum required repayment.

An Everyday Offset account is a transaction account that's linked to your Standard Variable Rate home loan or Investment home loan. Any money you put into your Everyday Offset account (e.g. your salary and savings) - whether its $2 or $20,000 - reduces the balance on which we charge interest. This means you'll only be paying interest on the difference. You can have multiple Everyday Offset accounts linked to one home loan. Only available for individual borrowers, not companies or trusts.
You can apply to top up your home loan by an additional $10,000 or more - subject to equity in your property and our approval.

Ability to switch your loan or repayment type, for example switching from a Standard Variable Rate to a Fixed Rate home loan or switch from Principal and Interest repayments to Interest Only payments.

Ability to split your loan balance into multiple loan accounts to take advantage of both fixed and variable rate home loans. This gives you the flexibility to structure your home loan to suit your individual needs by choosing the loan amount, loan type, loan term and repayment structure for each loan.

Enjoy interest rate discounts, no establishment fees and no monthly loan service fees for eligible home loans, and a fee waiver on one eligible credit card. To receive these benefits you must qualify for the home loan Package and have an initial Package lending balance of at least $150,000 at the time of your application.
Additional repayments can be made at any time. No fees apply.
Wherever you are in the world, CommBank gives you the choice and control to securely manage all of your accounts on a range of devices, the way you want.

A guarantor is someone who agrees to be responsible for repaying a debt owed to us under a loan provided to another individual or business, if the borrower(s) can't make their repayments. A guarantor supports the loan by providing us with additional security such as a property they own. By providing a guarantee, we may lend to the borrower in situations where they may not have been able to secure the full amount on their own.

This loan can be used for the purposes of owner occupied property purchases, refinancing your existing home loan, purchasing of vacant land (non-commercial), personal needs (e.g. home renovations, consolidation of personal debt, personal investments), off the plan purchases, bridging loan and building/construction purposes.
This loan cannot be used for business purposes
1-30 years (Subject to our approval)
